Experience working with both structured and unstructured data to inform analytical models and business insights.

Data Processing & Infrastructure Knowledge:

Experience with data processing tools (e.g., Apache Spark) and working in large-scale data environments (e.g., data lakes, warehouses).

Problem-Solving Skills:

Proven ability to identify business challenges and apply data-driven solutions to address them.

Communication & Collaboration:

Ability to translate complex data analysis into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Experience in the travel or technology sector, applying data science to product or operational improvements.

Technologies:

Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric.

We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here, you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.




This posting includes a base salary range that this company would reasonably expect to pay the selected candidate. Individual compensation offers within the range are based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, credentials, education, training, the demand for the role, skillset, and overall business and local labour market considerations. Most candidates are hired at a salary within the range disclosed. Salary range: CA$190K-CA$220K. In addition, the details highlighted in this job posting above are a general description of all other expected benefits and compensation for the position.

Location: Toronto or Bristol (Hybrid)

This is a hybrid position primarily based in Bristol, UK or Toronto, Canada. We’re committed to your flexibility and wellbeing and our hybrid strategy currently requires three days a week in the office, giving you the option to work remotely for some of your working week. Find out more about our culture of flexible working .

We give you a world of potential

Computershare is renowned for its expertise in data management, high volume transaction processing, payments and communications. Many of the world’s leading organizations use these core competencies to help maximize the value of relationships with their investors, employees, creditors, members and customers.

Our vision is to leverage our global network, specialized technology, local and global financial markets expertise and unsurpassed service levels to keep Computershare at the forefront of the industry. As the perfect partner for organizations seeking consolidated tailored solutions and superior service, we constantly strive to widen the gap in quality between us and our competitors.

The Finance function is responsible for providing transactional accounting services, treasury, financial planning, analysis, reporting and commercial finance support to all business units and functions throughout Computershare, across all global locations.

A role you will love

Reporting to the Commercial Finance Director, the Senior Finance Analyst will play a key role in producing, consolidating, interpreting and improving analysis based on data from a variety of sources.

They will be responsible for maintaining, delivering and improving analytical processes that support senior management by providing clear insights to inform decisions and drive the future long-term performance of the business. The role involves analyzing large sets of financial and non-financial data including volume, pricing and customer data across multiple geographies and seeking to establish trends and ways in which we can improve our financial and business planning and decisions.

Ability to link non-financial data (KPIs, volume drivers) to explain financial results and variances
Use a variety of internal and external data sources to undertake a broad range of analyses covering key aspects of our business. Examples include:
Customer Analysis – pricing, profitability, cross selling, single view, impact of M&A involving our clients
Product analysis – volumes, pricing, profitability, viability of new launches
Competitor Analysis – CPU differentiation, SWOT analysis, opportunities for competitive advantage
Cost analysis – workforce efficiency / productivity, identify and measure factors which drive cost into our business, discretionary spend effectiveness e.g. marketing, consulting.
Investment analysis – appraise software development proposals or other projects to maximise returns
Review month end and forecast commentary provided by FP&A and identify items or variances requiring deeper analysis. Carry out such analysis
Support M&A projects where modelling or analysis is required.
Establish the most appropriate data sources on which to base our analyses
Create and maintain financial models to facilitate the above analyses as well as ‘what if scenarios’ and sensitivities.
Interpret the completed analysis and identify the key findings, such that we can answer the crucial question of ‘so what?’
Take the findings and conclusions from analysis performed and
Present recommendations to the Lead Business Partner and / or the relevant business manager.
Identify and communicate potential business improvements
Input to the budget / forecast / 5YP processes to improve our financial planning
For new initiatives, products or investments, track actual performance against original analysis / modelling.
Recommend ways in which analysis can be standardised and simplified across regions and business units in order to deliver more efficiently

What will you bring to the role?

We are a global business with an entrepreneurial spirit, and we are proud of that. What that comes with is a fast-paced environment and lots of change so you will be resilient in nature and able to adapt quickly and embrace the pace of change we often work under.

Key skills desired for the role include:

Required:

Minimum 2 years of financial and analytical experience.
Bachelor’s degree (B.A./B.S.) or equivalent in a discipline requiring numeracy, problem solving or analytical thinking. For example economics, statistics, engineering, computer science, data science, business analytics, finance/accounting
Advanced Excel skills with modelling experience

Required:

CFA or appetite to study for CFA qualification would be encouraged
ACA/ACCA/CIMA qualified (or local equivalent) would also be relevant
Master’s degree in a quantitative field or relevant field
Experience with visualization software such as Tableau or business intelligent tools
Experience with multiple AI/ML Algorithms, C++ or Java and SQL and database management.

Rewards designed for you

Flexible work to help you find the best balance between work and lifestyle.

Health and wellbeing rewards that can be tailored to support you and your family.

Invest in our business by setting aside salary to purchase shares in our company, and you’ll receive a company contribution as well.

Extra rewards ranging from recognition awards and team get togethers to helping you invest in your future.

And more . Ours is a welcoming and close-knit community, with experienced colleagues ready to help you grow. Our handbook will help you find out more about our rewards and life at Computershare, visit computershare.com/careers-handbook

Qui nous sommes

Pratt & Whitney Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des 20 meilleurs employeurs au Canada pour 2024 selon Forbes et cette liste nous a classé comme le meilleur employeur dans l'industrie de l'aérospatiale et de la défense au pays ! De plus, en 2024, notre siège social a été nommé comme l’un des meilleurs employeurs dans la région de Montréal, et nous avons également reçu la certification parité des genres en niveau Or décernée par l'organisation La Gouvernance au Féminin pour la sixième année de suite. Ensemble, ces distinctions confirment notre réputation d'employeur de choix dans la région de Montréal, au Canada et dans le monde.




Pourquoi rejoindre l’équipe


Nous sommes en pleine transformation numérique, redéfinissant notre manière de travailler, optimisant nos opérations et transformant nos produits et services pour améliorer les expériences des employés et des clients.

En tant que membre de notre équipe de Technologie Numérique, vous contribuerez à façonner l’avenir en travaillant avec des outils avancés, en automatisant les processus et en innovant dans toutes les fonctions de l’entreprise.

Notre organisation mondiale est déterminée à cultiver une équipe diversifiée, autonome et compétente afin d’apporter des solutions avancées et des capacités numériques à la pointe de la technologie à nos clients.

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien ?

Collaborer avec des scientifiques de données pour tester et mettre à l’échelle de nouveaux algorithmes dans notre environnement analytique, puis industrialiser les solutions, les surveiller et les maintenir en production.

Influencer, construire et maintenir la plateforme analytique à grande échelle nécessaire pour les projets d’IA, et intégrer cette plateforme avec l’infrastructure/service DT pour fournir une solution de bout en bout.

Utiliser une compréhension de l’architecture logicielle et des modèles de conception pour écrire du code évolutif, maintenable, bien conçu et à l’épreuve du temps.

Concevoir, développer et maintenir le cadre pour le pipeline analytique.

Développer des composants communs pour résoudre les problèmes rencontrés dans les projets de machine learning, tels que la gestion du cycle de vie des modèles, le stockage des caractéristiques et l’évaluation de la qualité des données.

Fournir des suggestions et aider à mettre en œuvre des cadres et des outils pour améliorer la qualité des données.

Travailler au sein d’équipes agiles interfonctionnelles composées d’ingénieurs logiciels et de machine learning hautement qualifiés, de data scientists, de designers, de chefs de produits, et d’autres membres pour construire l’écosystème IA au sein de l’entreprise.

Qu’est-ce qu’il vous faut pour réussir?

Master ou diplôme supérieur en informatique, ingénierie informatique, statistiques ou domaines similaires

Plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de Machine Learning, Data Scientist, Data Engineer ou ingénieur logiciel

Capacité à transformer des modèles de machine learning en preuve de concept en solutions évolutives

Capacité à appliquer les meilleures pratiques du développement logiciel aux projets de machine learning, y compris les tests unitaires, l'intégration DevOps, la gestion des versions, le développement piloté par les tests, etc.

Ce poste s’inscrit dans un milieu de travail francophone, néanmoins il nécessite une très bonne connaissance de l’anglais pour lire et comprendre, sur une base quotidienne, de la documentation et des termes techniques qui peuvent émaner d’organisations internationales, ainsi que pour écrire et communiquer en anglais avec des clients, des fournisseurs ou des collègues internationaux.

Who are we

Pratt & Whitney Canada has been recognized as one of the top 20 on Forbes’ Canada’s Best Employers for 2024, a list that also ranked us as the best Canadian employer in the aerospace and defense industry! Why Join The Team


We are on a digital transformation journey, redefining how we work, optimizing operations and transforming products and services to elevate employee and customer experiences. As part of our Digital Technology team, you’ll help shape the future, working with advanced tools, automating processes and innovating across all business functions. Our global organization is committed to cultivating a diverse, empowered and skilled team to bring advanced solutions and leading-edge digital capabilities to market for our customers.

What will your day-to-day look like?

Collaborate with data scientists to test and scale new algorithms within our analytics environment and later industrialize the solutions, monitor and maintain them in production

Influence, build and maintain the large-scale analytics platform required for the AI projects, and integrate with DT infrastructure/service to provide an end-to-end solution

Leverage an understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed and future-proof code

Design, develop and maintain the framework for analytical pipeline

Develop common components to address pain points in machine learning project, like model lifecycle management, feature store and data quality evaluation

Provide input and help implement framework and tools to improve data quality

Work in cross-functional agile teams of highly skilled software/machine learning engineers, data scientists, designers, product managers and others to build the AI ecosystem within the company

What do you need to be successful?

M.S. or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or related topics

3+ years of experience working in a Machine Learning, Data Scientist, Data Engineer or Software Engineer role

Ability to transform proof of concept machine learning models into scalable solutions

Ability to apply software development best practice into machine learning projects, including unit test, DevOps integration, release management, test driven development, etc.

This position is part of a French-speaking work environment, it requires a very good knowledge of English to read and understand, on a daily basis, documentation and technical terms that may emanate from international organizations, as well as to write and communicate in English with customers, suppliers or international colleagues.

Job Description
You will be working on a flexible hybrid schedule as part of Fidelity’s dynamic working arrangement.
Who We Are
At Fidelity, we’ve been helping Canadian investors build better financial futures for over 35 years. We offer individuals and institutions a range of trusted investment portfolios and services - and we’re constantly seeking to find new and better ways to help our clients. As a privately owned company, we boldly embrace innovation in all areas as we continue to grow our business into the future.
Working with us means you’ll be part of a diverse and dedicated group of people who make a real difference for our clients and communities every day. You’ll have a wide range of opportunities to grow and develop your career in an inclusive environment where you’ll feel valued and supported to be your best - both personally and professionally.
How You’ll Make an Impact
The Manager, Machine Learning Development and Analytics is responsible for managing a team of machine learning analysts that delivers high-quality, efficient, and impactful machine learning solutions in support of business functions across Fidelity Canada. Reporting to the VP Business Analytics, the position plays a critical role in ensuring the Finance and Corporate Services department delivers on its goal of continuously providing value added analysis that shapes and drives the direction of the business.
Supervise the development, testing, and optimization of machine learning models, ensuring they meet performance requirements and business objectives
Oversee the management of data pipelines, infrastructure, and tools required for machine learning, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and secure
Stay current with the latest machine learning research and technologies, and promote a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team
Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of machine learning projects, including planning, execution, and deployment, while managing timelines, resources, and risks
Ensure that machine learning models adhere to industry standards, regulations, and ethical guidelines, and are thoroughly tested before deployment
Lead, mentor, and develop a team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, and analysts, ensuring they have the resources and support needed to succeed
What We’re Looking For
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science / Engineering / Statistics / Mathematics or equivalent work experience.
5+ years as a Machine Learning Developer with Open-Source and end-to-end development experience
Experience managing a team of statisticians and/or machine learning analysts
Deep knowledge of various data manipulation / machine learning / statistical frameworks (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, sckikit-learn, XGBoost, BSTS, S/ARIMAX)
High degree of programming proficiency in Python and SQL
Excellent understanding of cloud-based data engineering concepts (ETL, Datawarehousing) in AWS and Snowflake
Expert at leveraging Amazon SageMaker as a complete end to end data science platform
The Expertise You Bring:
Extensive knowledge of the financial industry and capital markets with a focus on asset and/or wealth management
Hands on experience with advanced machine learning techniques, big data technologies and statistical methods
Proven track record of leading the adoption of new tools, techniques or processes that improve the efficiency or accuracy of value-added analysis
Graduate degree in Data Science / Business Analytics / Applied Mathematics / Applied Statistics; or equivalent is an asset
Completed AWS Machine Learning and/or SnowPro Core Certification is an asset
Strong verbal and written communication skills to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Current work authorization for Canada is required for all openings.
Some of the ways we’ll help you feel valued and supported as part of our team:
Flexible working arrangements - 100% remote, hybrid, and in office options
Competitive total compensation, including company contributions to your group RRSP without a matching requirement from you
Comprehensive health benefits that start on your first day, with 100% employer-paid premiums, that include up to $5000 annually for mental health services and therapy
Parental leave top-up to 100% of your salary for a period of 25 weeks

Generous time off policy, including 2 paid days annually to volunteer at a charity of your choice

Extensive professional development opportunities, including access to over 11,000 training and development courses, tuition reimbursement, and monetary rewards for completing a required designation

Dynamic Risk is a widely recognized integrity, risk management and software solutions company within the energy sector. We’ve been delivering our expertise and solutions since 1996 and we’ve become the industry-leading provider of pipeline integrity management solutions, which includes our suit of IRAS Software Applications.

This role oversees the software and analytics platform, managing releases, roadmaps, and go-to-market activities like pricing, customer engagement, and sales enablement. It involves driving product innovation, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and aligning ILI software priorities with business objectives. The role also focuses on market trends, pricing strategies, and expanding SaaS offerings while ensuring continuous, high-quality product development and managing risks for new initiatives.
Job Overview

Owns and manages the software and analytics platform including releases, roadmaps and go to market activities such as pricing, messaging, customer engagement, sales pipeline generation and sales enablement. Driving roadmap prioritization for ILI software and analytics with alignment across Gas PM, Liquids PM & Dynamic Risk GM
Creates, identifies, and evangelizes new concepts that result in business model innovation (product, sales, services, and delivery)
Is accountable for organizational and business objectives/targets and is involved in long-term planning and managing complex issues to ensure success of business strategy.
Lead a cross-functional team to drive delivery of differentiated high revenue impact software products, platforms and features.
Develop specialized knowledge of latest commercial market trends and competition in the inline inspection and integrity management space including factors that differentiate them.
Defines and implements pricing strategies based on customer value propositions to maximize product value and market competitiveness.
Validates desirability, feasibility, viability, and adaptability of existing software platforms to increase software revenues and contribution margins for software and tech enabled services. Including launching and expanding SaaS product offerings
Partner with engineering leaders, project operations and technical product managers to ensure there is a strong development process that delivers continuous, high quality product and service releases
Have a strong understanding of technology and architecture and its impact on the solution delivered to the customer, costs (software) and risks to the product release (including performance specifications).
Risk assessment and management for new product initiatives and product updates.
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications/Education:

A bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, engineering, or related discipline is required
Minimum of eight years of experience in Product Management is required
Minimum of two years of experience working for data technology companies
Experience:

Must have proven track record of substantially growing a company through product led growth
Knowledge of how to improve product management processes, outcomes, and ongoing results
Highly skilled at defining portfolio and investment decisions that balance new customer needs, install base requirements and long-term differentiation.
Identified industry dynamics, trends and policies to drive the product team to explore alternate technologies and approaches to solve customers’ problems in a manner that results in significant growth.
Able to make strategic partnership decisions for product offerings including when to buy, build or partner and creation of new sales channels.
Is highly skilled with product management best practices such as setting and driving value-based pricing.
Ability to manage competing stakeholders asks into an aligned roadmap and value proposition for the development team.
Able to do and articulate a cost, benefit, reliability, and risk analysis of alternatives.
Assess competitors and create battle cards.
Strong verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills
Strong knowledge& experience building data platforms(ingest, analytics, data science, data management, data quality, dev ops)including industry standards, best practices and the ability to evaluate trade-offs in technical choices.
Strong acumen of hardware & software development lifecycle and product design.
Skilled with executing a continuous delivery methodology of build, test, iterate for hardware, software & service solutions.
Proven leadership with a strong commitment to advocating for key initiatives, motivating teams, and driving continuous improvement.
Demonstrated ability to proactively identify issues, drive cross-functional collaboration, and resolve challenges through critical thinking, best practices, and innovative problem-solving.
Experience in coaching and mentoring colleagues, effectively communicating complex information, and building consensus among stakeholders.
Strong persuasive skills, with the capacity to communicate data-driven reasoning, influence outcomes, and navigate stakeholder dynamics.
Expertise in assessing risks, managing uncertainty, and making confident decisions based on data analysis, even in ambiguous situations.
Resilience in pursuing goals, maintaining positivity, and exploring alternative solutions despite setbacks.
Commitment to continuous learning and staying abreast of market changes to drive business innovation.

Job Summary

Consumer Protection BC is a not-for-profit regulator responsible for overseeing certain sectors and specific types of consumer transactions. Our vision is a province where all citizens of BC are empowered in their transactions as a result of rigorous and consistent business compliance and through the provision of information.

We are a small team of dedicated and passionate individuals who champion our corporate values of curiosity, integrity and impact. These employee-chosen values guide the delivery of our services and can be seen in our daily work. As an equal opportunity workplace, our values guide our business activities, regulatory work, education efforts, interactions and corporate culture and are supported by the tenets of diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility. Learn more about who we are as a regulator and employer by exploring our website, including our about us page and our careers page.

Consumer Protection BC is looking for a Manager of Data Science & Analytics to join our team!

If you are interested, review the job description and apply online by uploading your cover letter and resume and answering a few pre-screening questions within our online application portal.

Day in the life:

When you get to the office, you have a nice chat with your colleagues before settling in for a meaningful workday. As a self-driven individual, you spend most of your morning working on analyzing some recent inspections data looking for trends and anomalies. Building a predictive model to better inform our inspections work is your primary responsibility right now and you delight in the work.

After a nice social lunch and an espresso (coffee is on us!), you come back to your desk to work on internal data policies, ensuring plain language the entire organization can understand and use. This work feeds into a presentation you’re giving to all staff to bring them along on your progress. Your work in progressing the organization’s overall data literacy means employees understand better than ever how data and analysis can enhance work processes. You gather feedback and commit to reviewing their concerns and suggestions and reporting back.

Before heading out, you look at tomorrow’s calendar. You’re meeting with the Inspections team to talk about their processes, a step that will continue your predictive modelling work. Although, you never know when a data analysis need comes up, so you are open to being flexible with your priorities as needs surface throughout the day. Afterall, you appreciate the ability to be involved with other departments and you are grateful for the opportunity to learn new things all the time.

Who you are:

An information seeking problem solver who can analyze an issue, identify underlying causes and generate solutions
A team player who enjoys working with diverse teams, work groups and across an organization to achieve group and organizational goals.
A proactive planner who can establish priorities but also be flexible and adapt to different situations, information and groups of individuals.

What you will be doing:

Using your advanced knowledge of statistics and analytical modeling to draw insights that inform strategic and operational decision-making.
Acting as the key statistical resource internally and externally with our stakeholders, including working on diverse teams or attending external meetings.
Guiding individuals, teams, and leadership in your areas of expertise to ensure work processes and procedures are effectively implemented and communicated across the organization.

We are looking for people who have:

Post-secondary education with a focus in statistics, mathematics, data science, research or other related fields of study or a combination of education and experience.
Minimum two years’ experience in advanced analytics, complex statistical analysis, mathematical modeling, data mining, data visualization and optimization.
Proven track-record of applying modeling techniques and statistics to solve real world problems.

Are we a good fit for each other?

We want to help you decide if we are a good fit for one another. Take a look at our website www.consumerprotectionbc.ca/careers for all the information.

Accessibility

Do you need accommodation during the interview process? Please read our information about requesting an accommodation.

The full application process will take approximately eight weeks to complete. We would like to have someone in place by the end of January 2025.

Company Description


At Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership (MLSE), we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that is representative of our community and where all employees feel they belong and can reach their full potential. We are Canada’s preeminent leader in delivering top quality sport and entertainment experiences and one of North America’s leading providers of exceptional fan experiences. We are the parent company of the National Hockey League’s Toronto Maple Leafs, the National Basketball Association’s Toronto Raptors, Major League Soccer’s Toronto FC, the Canadian Football League’s Toronto Argonauts and development teams with the Toronto Marlies (American Hockey League), Raptors 905 (NBA G League), Toronto FC II (MLS NEXT Pro League) and Raptors Uprising Gaming Club, the Toronto Raptors Esports franchise in the NBA 2K League.

MLSE owns and/or operates all the venues our teams play and train in, including Scotiabank Arena, BMO Field, Coca-Cola Coliseum, Ford Performance Centre, BMO Training Ground, and OVO Athletic Centre. We also provide fans in Toronto with incredible live music and entertainment events, as well as exceptional culinary experiences through our restaurants (e11even and RS) and clubs (Hot Stove Club, ScotiaClub and Platinum Club). Through MLSE Foundation, we have invested more than $45 million into Ontario communities since 2009 and with MLSE LaunchPad, we provide a place where youth facing barriers use sport to recognize and reach their potential.

We achieve all of this through our Common Purpose - to unite and empower our employees to create extraordinary moments for our fans and each other. Come be a part of the team.


Job Description


As part of the Business Analytics team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping venue operations and ticketing strategies, supporting data-driven decision-making for operational excellence and fan engagement.

This role will collaborate with our business teams to provide actionable insights and recommendations that enhance operational efficiency, improve resource utilization, and optimize revenue strategies. You will leverage your analytical expertise and business acumen to work on initiatives including labour and resource planning, demand forecasting and revenue optimization, and measurement and reporting of sales. This role requires close collaboration with cross-functional teams, including Digital Labs, Marketing, Venue Operations, and Ticketing, to deliver impactful insights that drive business success.

Collaborate with the business to analyze data (demand forecasting, pricing, resource allocation, labour planning) from a variety of sources and topic areas to ultimately inform business decisions by leveraging a suite of tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, R, Python, PowerBI).
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) providing actionable recommendations to enhance operational effectiveness and revenue growth.
Partner with stakeholders to analyze sales trends, secondary market data, fan segmentation and competitive analysis to benchmark venue and ticketing performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of insights into business strategies by displaying complex quantitative data in a simple and intuitive manner.

Qualifications


Note: Before reviewing the qualifications listed below, we want you to know that we understand you may not meet all the qualifications described and have other relevant expertise and experience. We invite you to please share this with us in the "Message to the Hiring Manager" section of our online application.

Bachelor’s or graduate degree in business, statistics, data science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in operations, ticketing, or data analytics, preferably in the sports or entertainment industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and PowerBI.
Proficiency in Python or R.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on operational and revenue optimization, labour planning, cost modelling, resource management strategies revenue management, and demand forecasting techniques.
Demonstrated experience and ability to manage complex projects with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills and ability to explain complex insights to a non-technical audience.
Experience and knowledge of modeling techniques (such as regression modeling, a/b testing, significance testing etc.) is ideal.
Experience in consulting or project management is considered an asset.
Passion for sports and a commitment to delivering exceptional fan experiences.
Collaborative, team-oriented attitude with a strong work ethic.

Additional Information

Experience the thrill of the Sports & Entertainment industry in a flexible (hybrid) work environment that supports employee wellbeing.

FPT Software is a global leader in IT services, providing cutting-edge technology solutions to clients worldwide. With our deep expertise in AI, digital transformation, and cloud services, we empower businesses to achieve operational excellence and drive innovation. As we continue to expand our AI-driven offerings, we are seeking a talented Pre-Sales Consultant to join our dynamic team in Montreal.


Position Overview:



The Pre-Sales Consultant for AI Solutions will play a critical role in supporting the sales process by providing technical expertise, designing AI-based solutions, and creating compelling proposals tailored to client needs. This role is ideal for a tech-savvy professional with strong business acumen, excellent communication skills, and a passion for AI technologies.


Key Responsibilities:





Collaborate with Sales Teams:
Partner with the sales team to understand customer requirements and present FPT Software's AI solutions that best meet their needs.
Participate in client meetings, presentations, and product demonstrations, serving as the technical expert on AI solutions.


Solution Design & Proposal Development:
Design customized AI solutions based on client needs, including use cases, deployment plans, and technical specifications.
Develop detailed solution proposals and presentations that demonstrate the business value of FPT Software's AI offerings.


Technical Expertise & Presentations:
Maintain an in-depth understanding of FPT Software's AI services and emerging trends in AI and machine learning.
Deliver clear, persuasive product demonstrations and presentations to clients, addressing both technical and business questions.


Client Engagement & Consultation:
Engage with potential clients to conduct discovery sessions, analyze business challenges, and recommend AI-driven solutions.
Build trusted relationships with clients, acting as an advisor and offering insights on the application of AI to meet their strategic goals.


Collaboration with Internal Teams:
Work closely with AIC product management, and technical teams to align proposed solutions with company capabilities and innovation roadmap.
Ensure seamless communication between the client and internal teams during the solution design and implementation process.


Documentation & Reporting:
Prepare comprehensive documentation for solution proposals, including technical requirements, case studies, and pricing models.
Provide regular updates to sales leadership on pre-sales activities, client feedback, and the status of deals in the pipeline.



Qualifications & Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field; or equivalent practical experience.
3+ years of experience in a pre-sales, technical sales support, or solutions architect role, preferably within AI, machine learning, or technology solutions.
Strong knowledge of AI/ML technologies and frameworks, with the ability to translate technical features into business value.
The candidate should have skills like Data Engineer or ML Engineer (with good knowledge of industrial tools & platforms) with a real past project record.
Excellent communication skills in English and French, both verbal and written.
Experience in developing technical proposals, solution architecture, and sales presentations.
Demonstrated ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, engaging clients at multiple levels of an organization.

L'équipe Unity Ads développe des solutions de publicité et de livraison de contenu personnalisé utilisées dans des centaines de milliers d'applications. L'équipe Auction Efficiency développe des produits révolutionnaires centrés sur l'apprentissage automatique. Ces produits fournissent des millions de prévisions chaque seconde afin d'optimiser l'efficacité et la rentabilité de la plateforme Ads Exchange de l'entreprise. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e ) Scientifique des données sénior talentueux(se) qui rejoindra une équipe de développeur(se)s exceptionnelle qui travaillent à l'amélioration des performances et des fonctionnalités de ces produits. Vous contribuerez grandement à l'élaboration, à la mise en œuvre et à la réalisation de nouvelles initiatives publicitaires qui ont un effet direct sur les revenus de l'entreprise et les relations avec ses clients. Ce que vous allez faire

Développer et entretenir des modèles d'apprentissage automatique qui maximiseront les performances et la rentabilité de notre plateforme d'échange de publicités, en influençant les décisions relatives à des milliards de demandes de publicité chaque jour

The opportunity
Unity Ads builds advertising and personalized content delivery solutions used in hundreds of thousands of apps. Our platform generates and processes extensive datasets that are used by machine learning systems living at the core of our various products.

In the Auction Efficiency team, we develop groundbreaking ML-centric products. These products provide millions of predictions every second to optimize the efficiency and profitability of the company's main Ads Exchange. We're looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join an outstanding team of engineers working to expand the performance and functionality of these products. You will have a huge impact on scoping out, contributing, and delivering new Ads initiatives that have a direct effect on company revenue and client relationships. This is an excellent chance to work with some of the best in the industry on products that directly impact the company's bottom line.

What you'll be doing

Develop and maintain machine learning models that maximize the performance and profitability of our ads exchange, influencing decisions on billions of ad requests each day.
Translate business problems into a design and implement advanced machine learning models and algorithms.
Conduct model evaluations and use metrics to drive continuous improvement.
Form and validate hypotheses about model performance by conducting rigorous experiments.

What we're looking for

Experience as a data scientist with strong programming skills
Experience in leading data science projects from ideation to production in various problem domains.
Proficiency in Python, with a strong understanding of best coding practices.
Experience with production-grade machine learning model development using Tensorflow or Pytorch.
Experience with Cloud Computing

You might also have

Extensive experience in writing and optimizing pipelines for model training and evaluation, utilizing frameworks such as Tensorflow Extended (TFX).
Proficient in probabilistic modeling frameworks, including Tensorflow Probability and PyMC, with practical experience on Google Cloud Platform.
Skilled in mobile advertisement technology and applications.

WHO WE ARE
When it comes to health, we’re always looking for ways to push for better. It’s why we were founded in the first place. In 1957, our founder, pharmacist William Wilkinson, witnessed a mother sacrifice her health by forgoing her own medicine to pay for her sick daughter’s prescription. He knew there had to be a better way. So, he introduced North America’s first prepaid drug plan, and GreenShield was born as a not-for-profit with a mission to support better health for all Canadians.

We aren’t just a health and benefits company. We’re the only not-for-profit social enterprise that brings worlds of coverage and care together, all in one place.
We’re noble challengers, purposefully building a better way and we need the best people to help us create a more holistic approach that takes care of the mind and body.

Our mission is to create better health for all Canadians, and we know that starts with our employees.

THE ROLE IN A NUTSHELL


Generating insights from the data and developing AI models to automate decisions and predict outcomes are key deliverables of the CoE. We are looking for an advanced data & reporting analyst to work with our Individual Insurance business to create & maintain visual dashboards, generate insights that have been identified as important to GreenShield’s individual sales success, but also very importantly for the candidate to explore and propose the art of the possible with Data and AI.

Learn the business domain of our Individual Direct to Consumer and Group Conversion insurance programs.
Partner with the Individual Sales and Marketing teams to develop metrics, frameworks, dashboards, and forecasts to support business oversight and ambitious net sales growth targets across multiple distribution channels with automation where relevant.
Evaluate the efficiency of marketing and sales campaigns, from lead generation through to engagement, conversion, retention and portfolio expansion.
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging data and AI to drive business outcomes in the Individual Insurance business unit.
Analyze data to extract and share insights that help drive the right decisions, with key focus on optimizing performance across the entire customer journey, budget management, and overall delivery of campaign or FTE performance.
Design and support a test & learn environment, conducting geo-experiments, A/B tests etc. to measure the impact of online and offline advertising, lead quality, operational sales effectiveness. This includes knowledge of matched market tests, holdout groups, and incrementality measurement techniques.
Develop correlations, statistical or machine learning models to generate insights or predictions and apply to the sales operation and marketing teams campaigns and tools (e.g. marketing Mix models, propensity models for targeting & sales lead optimization, frameworks to illustrate diminishing returns).
Maintain or innovate on existing reports and ensure consistent delivery timelines and data accuracy.
Translate business objectives into actionable analysis and own end-to-end analytics, and effectively communicate complex analytics to a broader audience in writing and presentation formats.
Develop and maintain a firm understanding of business needs, drivers, strategies, and targets and serve as a member of the Individual D2C sales management team.
Design and deliver on business requests for specialized reports or deep dives into the drivers or levers influencing the individual business.
Lead use cases related to data science and advanced analytics.
Establish channel and budget forecasts, with speed and ownership, suggesting tactics and strategies to adjust quickly based on learnings, opportunities and business objectives.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Undergraduate or graduate degree in data science, computer science, engineering, math, statistics, physical sciences, or equivalent.

Project Description:


The main goal is to find candidates who have previous experience working on cross functional teams to identify the right problems to solve, prioritize those problems, identify success metrics (definition of success for the solution), identify a research plan to investigate a feasible solution that can achieve these success metrics, identify or create the data required to run the experiment, set up and run the experiments required to prove out the idea, communicate those results with the cross functional team and leadership, and iteratively adjust approach until we achieve a viable solution; then they should be able to deliver this solution in partnership with the engineers on our teams. They should also have experience introducing product analytics and working with UXR teams to investigate the effectiveness of their solutions post release to production so that they can identify how successful their solution is and then iterate on it.


This could involve developing novel approaches or improving on existing approaches. Experience with python is required. Experience working on production level systems alongside of product teams should be a requirement. (I am not keen on hiring scientists that only have experience with pure research - they should have some experience delivering these solutions. They don't need to be the ones doing the engineering work to deliver the solutions but they need to have had experience working alongside of these engineers to deliver their solutions.) Experience working with some cloud compute provider (AWS, GCP, Azure) should be a requirement with a preference for those candidates that have experience on AWS.


Senior Applied Scientist


Thomson Reuters Labs in Toronto is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art Information Retrieval, Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning.


What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research in informational retrieval and natural language processing. We work closely with product and domain experts to identify compelling solutions at the intersection of user need and technical feasibility. Our team is responsible for designing the next generation of search technology for Legal and Tax Professionals in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. We own AI innovation for Thomson Reuters Research Products: Westlaw, Practical Law, and Checkpoint.


As an Applied Scientist in Labs, you will be part of a global interdisciplinary team of experts. We hire specialists across a variety of AI research areas, as well as engineers, to drive the company's digital transformation. TR Labs is known for delivering innovative AI products that serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.


About the role:


In this opportunity as a Senior Applied Scientist you will:

Experiment and Develop: You will drive the end-to-end model development lifecycle, championing best practices to ensure reproducible research and well-managed software delivery
Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe. You will elevate and mentor teammates
Deliver: With a sense of urgency and the desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will translate complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope. Our problems are complex; our solutions are right-sized. You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables
Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will foster innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges
Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will help lead the way in the adoption of AI across the enterprise.


Basic qualifications:

PhD in a relevant discipline or Master with a comparable level of experience
At least 5 years practical, relevant experience building NLP/IR/ML systems, from ideation to production
Solid software engineering skills for prototyping
Professional experience as a technical leader, translating complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope, coordinating and guiding the work of others


Preferred qualifications:

8 years practical experience building IR, ML or NLP systems in academia or industry
Demonstrated ability to translate cutting edge research into working prototypes and experience experimenting with novel IR or NLP models to solve real-world problems
Experience in fast-paced, agile environments managing uncertainty and ambiguity
Outstanding communication and data-driven decision-making collaboration with Product and Business Stakeholders
Proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala and experience delivering minimum viable products in large enterprise environments
Publications at relevant venues such as ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD or similar

Our Purpose
Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.
Title and Summary
Lead Data Scientist - Generative AI
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.

Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Services within Mastercard is responsible for acquiring, engaging, and retaining customers by managing fraud and risk, enhancing cybersecurity, and improving the digital payments experience. We provide value-added services and leverage expertise, data-driven insights, and execution.
Overview

Our Data Science team is responsible for creating deep learning Artificial Intelligence (A.I.) and Machine Learning (M.L.) models. The models generated are production ready and created to back specific products in Mastercard’s authentication and authorization networks. The Data Science team is also responsible for developing automated processes for creating models covering all modeling steps, from data extraction up to delivery. In addition, the processes must be designed to scale, to be repeatable, resilient, and industrialized.

As a Lead Data Scientist within the Security Solutions Data Science team, you will pilot groundbreaking Generative AI use cases aimed at revolutionizing sales enablement. By automating qualitative research and leveraging Mastercard’s network intelligence, your work will help us drive targeted, data-driven sales strategies that resonate with diverse industries and client needs.

The Role:
We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist with deep expertise in generative AI to spearhead projects that redefine how businesses approach automation, content creation, and predictive modeling. As a Lead Data Scientist within the Security Solutions Data Science team, you will pilot groundbreaking Generative AI use cases aimed at revolutionizing sales enablement. By automating qualitative research and leveraging Mastercard’s network intelligence, your work will help us drive targeted, data-driven sales strategies that resonate with diverse industries and client needs.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (data scientists, engineers, product managers, and sales) to design and develop innovative AI models that solve real-world problems.
Build and optimize data pipelines for model creation, testing, and evaluation.
Work with diverse datasets and deploy cutting-edge machine learning techniques to improve business outcomes.
Share your insights by delivering best practices, tutorials, and tailored content to technical and non-technical stakeholders alike
Lead the design, development, and deployment of generative AI models, including natural language processing (NLP), deep learning (DL), and reinforcement learning (RL) approaches.
Build and optimize large-scale machine learning pipelines to process vast datasets and enhance model performance.
Conduct research on cutting-edge AI techniques, exploring novel applications of generative AI in areas like text generation, video synthesis, and automated content creation.
Communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, providing insights and recommendations to drive business outcomes.
Ensure the scalability and reliability of AI models in production environments.

All About You:

Proven experience as a data scientist, especially in building large-scale machine learning or deep learning models (e.g., CNN, RNN).
Strong expertise in Python and extensive experience building large scale machine learning models with LLM using technologies such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet or Keras.
Knowledge of data pipeline tools like Apache NiFi, Airflow, or equivalents.
Experience working with SQL, PostGreSQL and familiarity of working with large datasets and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark,).
Expertise in natural language processing (NLP), deep learning (DL), and other AI subfields.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for AI model deployment.
Strong problem-solving abilities, with an innovative mindset and a passion for exploring new AI frontiers.
Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related STEM field.

Nice to Have

Experience with real-time model deployment and API integration.
Familiarity with ethical AI practices and frameworks.
Experience in reinforcement learning and decision-making models.

SICKKIDS FOUNDATION IS ON THE HUNT FOR AN EXTRAORDINARY

ABOUT US

SickKids Foundation, with over 50 years of philanthropic impact in 2023, is Canada's largest charitable funder of child health research, learning and care, raising over $200 million last year. As a national charity, SickKids Foundation invests in national and international initiatives to benefit children in Canada and around the world. As the fundraising partner to The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids), we are aligned in supporting Precision Child Health (PCH), the future of tailoring medicine to each child's unique traits so SickKids can diagnose faster, treat smarter, and predict better.




Today, SickKids Foundation has a new strategic plan grounded in our values of collaboration, inclusion, integrity, innovation and excellence.




Our key strategic pillars are:

Increase sustainable revenue to meet ongoing funding priorities.
Invest in targeted innovation to drive sustainable revenues and improve efficiencies.
Deliver our donor promise to build and strengthen long-term relationships.



The strategic pillars are supported by our key strategic enablers:

Invest in our people and culture to attract and retain top talent.
Disrupt the market through data and technology to drive strategic priorities.
Capitalize on our brand to build global recognition that inspires sustainable support.



SickKids Foundation is committed to an inclusive culture by embedding equity, diversity and inclusion in our policies, practices, and behaviours. We aim to build awareness and skills in this area, both internally and with our partners. Our commitment extends to creating a safe, positive work environment. For details on our Equity, Diversity & Inclusion commitment, please click here.




We’re committed to attracting and retaining passionate individuals to help create a healthier future. That’s why SickKids Foundation is looking for a new Vice President, Business Intelligence and Analytics (BIA).




Position Status: Permanent Full-Time




Available: Immediately




Description of the Position:
At SickKids Foundation, we believe that data is more than numbers—it's the key to transforming lives. We’re searching for an innovative leader to shape the future of our Business Intelligence and Analytics team. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategy, elevate donor experiences, and fuel life-saving initiatives, this is your opportunity to make a difference.


In this newly created role, Vice President of Business Intelligence and Analytics (BIA), you will report directly to the Chief Information Office (CIO) and lead a talented team of analysts and data scientists dedicated to advancing data-driven decision-making across the organization. Your leadership will empower teams, including Donor-facing and Fundraising teams, Marketing, and Donor Experience, by providing the analytics, reporting, and strategic intelligence needed to maximize impact. Through innovative approaches and a focus on delivering results, you will ensure the Business Intelligence Analytics function plays a critical role in shaping how we engage donors and drive organizational success.

Required Skills

You will:




Strategic Leadership
An active member of the senior leadership team and trusted partner to the CEO and fellow executives, playing a vital role in:
Driving forward our mission, vision, and values with purpose and passion.
Bringing our new strategic plan to life through innovative and impactful initiatives.
Shaping both immediate and future goals that will define our success.
Champion a positive, forward-thinking culture that inspires excellence across our organization.
Design and implement leading-edge business intelligence and analytics platforms and services to drive business performance and growth.
Foster a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and leadership development within your team.



Business Intelligence (BI) and Analytics Technology Management

Lead the development of analytical dashboards for business units.
Develop collaborative relationships with internal teams and external partners, providing tailored analytics and insights to optimize donor engagement and empower business units to achieve their KPI’s and maximize impact.
Enhance and oversee our advanced BI and Analytics platforms, from Snowflake to Power BI, Datawarehouse, Google Analytics, SAS and niche AI/ML solutions.
Lead the design and implementation of cloud-based analytics architectures to streamline and support data driven decision-making.
Ensure business units have the strategic insights to facilitate meaningful connections with donors, fostering trust and loyalty.



Team Leadership:

Develop, lead, attract, inspire, manage a diverse, talented, and high-performing team to ensure that the mission and core values of SickKids Foundation are put into practice by holding everyone accountable for supporting our strategic goals.
Commitment to both personal and team professional development.
Support the teams’ efforts to achieve key performance indicators by providing strategic support, problem-solving, and the resources needed to succeed.




Qualifications:




While we know that for any job posting no one candidate will possess the qualifications being sought in equal measure, below is an outline of the qualifications we believe are important for a candidate to bring to the position or for the successful candidate to develop while in the role:




10-15 years of experience in computer science or data science related roles, including 5 years or more in senior leadership positions.
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or business analytics.
Master's degree or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field would be an asset.
Strong leadership, business relationship management, and team management skills, with a proven track record in building and managing analytics and data science teams.
Experience in developing and implementing comprehensive BI strategies.
Proficiency in cloud analytics, data warehousing, and business intelligence tools and platforms (Snowflake, Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Power BI, SAS, etc.)
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and business recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
In depth understanding of analytics and decision support requirements for both one-to-one relationship management and mass audience marketing, to drive improvement in revenue, engagement, and experience metrics.
If you are a passionate and results-driven analytics professional with a vision for creating lasting impact, we invite you to join us on this transformative journey as our new Vice President of Business Intelligence and Analytics. Together we will ignite transformational growth, make a significant difference, and share a brighter future for all.



We are an environment that looks to attract hardworking and committed people; people who are looking to challenge themselves and grow with a globally recognized brand that continues to change the world. We look forward to reviewing your application.

About Tantalus Systems (TSX: GRID)

Tantalus is a technology company dedicated to helping utilities modernize their distribution grids by harnessing the power of data across all their devices and systems deployed throughout the entire distribution grid – from the substation to the EV charger located behind the meter. We offer smart grid solutions across multiple levels: intelligent connected devices, communications networks, data management, enterprise applications and analytics.

Learn more at http://www.tantalus.com/.


Come join us if you’re interested in being part of an entrepreneurial team, solving complex technical problems and delivering innovative solutions that will directly impact the electrification of everything and the decarbonization of our society.




We have operations throughout the United States and Canada with offices in Burnaby (British Columbia, Canada), Raleigh (North Carolina, USA), and Norwalk (Connecticut, USA).


This position offers a competitive salary plus variable compensation based on performance targets and business objectives. Tantalus also offers generous benefits, including medical, dental and vision plans, healthcare and dependent care flexible spending accounts and paid time off.


Location of Position:

This role will be based in our Burnaby office, with opportunities to collaborate with colleagues across our Canadian and U.S. locations.




The Opportunity:

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Tantalus, you will join a dynamic, cross-functional team of innovative engineers and technologists. Our team leverages Tantalus’s comprehensive technology stack, which spans custom silicon, Industrial IoT (IIoT) devices, narrowband and broadband networks, cloud-native platforms, data aggregation, predictive analytics, machine learning, and cutting-edge visualization tools.


In this role, you will be at the forefront of product development, collaborating with teams from our Canadian and U.S. offices and working closely with global partners. You will help shape the future of electric, water, and gas distribution systems by developing advanced analytics tools that extract insights from vast amounts of time-series data collected from our Smart Metering systems.


Your expertise will be crucial in addressing complex problems within utility power distribution, including the integration of distributed energy resources like solar, wind, and electric vehicle charging stations. As a key technical leader, you will guide the development, verification, and delivery of machine learning-based solutions, drawing from a wide range of statistical, supervised, unsupervised, and hybrid models to meet the unique challenges of our industry.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, test, and maintain large-scale software systems, ensuring high standards of quality, performance, and security.
Lead the development and delivery of new features and advanced capabilities for our grid management platform.
Design, build, and deploy scalable, production-ready machine learning and AI-driven solutions.
Evaluate algorithm performance, scalability, and suitability for real-world applications.
Conduct model development, optimization, verification, and deployment processes.
Analyze and decompose complex business requirements to develop clear, executable solutions.
Stay at the forefront of industry developments, maintaining a strong knowledge base of the latest in machine learning best practices and evolving frameworks.



Essential Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience.
7-10+ years of experience delivering large-scale systems to production environments.
A keen interest in time-series ML problems, Edge-ML and distributed systems.
Demonstrated experience in the following:
Building machine learning solutions leveraging architectures such as deep learning (e.g., LSTM, CNNs), reinforcement learning, and transformers.
Architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems.
Leading technical projects in ML design and optimizing large-scale ML infrastructure (e.g., model deployment, evaluation, data preprocessing, fine-tuning).
Designing cloud-native solutions and infrastructure for real-time or batch data processing.
Software design and architecture, including testing and launching products into production.
Strong experience across a broad range of programming languages including but not limited to Python, Java and C++.
Strong experience in an operational Linux environment and strong shell scripting skills.
Expertise in SQL for data extraction.
Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Jax, Ray, etc., and accelerators (e.g., TPUs, GPUs).
Familiarity with model architectures like encoders, decoders, and transformers, and experience with APIs and frameworks for machine learning.



Desired Qualifications:

Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
5+ years of experience in a technical leadership role, setting the direction for project teams.
Recent hands-on experience in developing and delivering ML-based solutions in production.
Experience in power transmission and distribution systems, especially with time series data analysis and integration of renewable energy sources.
Strong knowledge of performance metrics, real-time data processing, and risk analysis.



Personal Attributes:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a deep curiosity for data and innovation.
Passion for creating practical, high-impact machine learning solutions.
Self-motivated, independent, and able to manage multiple projects effectively.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Quick to learn new technologies, with an appetite for continuous learning and self-improvement.

Annual Salary Range: $80,556.20 - $92,047.14

Hybrid: Minimum two days per week (Wednesday & Thursday) in-office attendance required

Consumer Protection BCis looking fora Manager of Data Science & Analytics to join our team! If you are interested, review the job description (on our website) and apply online by uploading your cover letter and resume and answering a few pre-screening questions within our online application portal.

Day in the life:

When you get to the office, you have a nice chat with your colleagues before settling in for a meaningful workday. As a self-driven individual, you spend most of your morning working on analyzing some recent inspections data looking for trends and anomalies. Building a predictive model to better inform our inspections work is your primary responsibility right now and you delight in the work.

After a nice social lunch and an espresso (coffee is on us!), you come back to your desk to work on internal data policies, ensuring plain language the entire organization can understand and use. This work feeds into a presentation you’re giving to all staff to bring them along on your progress. Your work in progressing the organization’s overall data literacy means employees understand better than ever how data and analysis can enhance work processes. You gather feedback and commit to reviewing their concerns and suggestions and reporting back.

Before heading out, you look at tomorrow’s calendar. You’re meeting with the Inspections team to talk about their processes, a step that will continue your predictive modelling work. Although, you never know when a data analysis need comes up, so you are open to being flexible with your priorities as needs surface throughout the day. Afterall, you appreciate the ability to be involved with other departments and you are grateful for the opportunity to learn news things all the time.

Who you are:

An information seeking problem solver who can analyze an issue, identify underlying causes and generate solutions
A team player who enjoys working with diverse teams, work groups and across an organization to achieve group and organizational goals.
A proactive planner who can establish priorities but also be flexible and adapt to different situations, information and groups of individuals.

What you will be doing:

Using your advanced knowledge of statistics and analytical modeling to draw insights that inform strategic and operational decision-making.
Acting as the key statistical resource internally and externally with our stakeholders, including working on diverse teams or attending external meetings.
Guiding individuals, teams, and leadership in your areas of expertise to ensure work processes and procedures are effectively implemented and communicated across the organization.

We are looking for people who have:

Post-secondary education with a focus in statistics, mathematics, data science, research or other related fields of study or a combination of education and experience.
Minimum two years’ experience in advanced analytics, complex statistical analysis, mathematical modeling, data mining, data visualization and optimization.
Proven track-record of applying modeling techniques and statistics to solve real world problems.

The application process:

The full application process will take approximately eight weeks to complete. We would like to have someone in place by the end of January 2025.
Steps in the application process include application screening, telephone interview, data analysis assignment, in-person interview, professional references and a criminal record check (post offer).
We do not accept applications by email. We do not consider incomplete applications (those without cover letters, resumes and/or written responses to pre-screening questions).

Are we a good fit for each other?

We want to help you decide if we are a good fit for one another. Look at our website www.consumerprotectionbc.ca/careers for all the information.

Accessibility

Do you need accommodation during the interview process? Read our information about requesting an accommodation.

The Ballard team in Burnaby British Columbia is searching for a Senior Systems Design Applied Scientist. The Senior Systems Design Applied Scientist will play a key role in profitably delivering innovative clean energy solutions to our customers by providing engineering guidance and support in the development and deployment of fuel cell systems.
This position requires a view of the system that encompasses not only system design, but logistics associated with field deployment, production, customer experience and continuation engineering. This position will require constant attention to parallel design efforts to ensure they converge on the intended system design in the face of changing requirements. Effective communication with engineering resources in other countries and time zones will be required.
Responsibilities:
Develop requirements documentation including product specification, product requirements and market requirements documentation.
Determine and define sub-system interfaces to optimize different aspects of the system such as field serviceability, system reliability and cost distribution.
Must be able to create systems models and model components to accurately predict performance under various environmental and lifecycle conditions.
Work with customers during all product lifecycle phases to ensure effective requirements and quality alignment.
Perform tradeoff studies for different system configurations and operating strategies.
Perform gap analysis between system requirements and marketing/product requirements.
Provide technical consultation to engineering group on BOP components where suitability for certain applications is concerned.
Participate in product lifecycle maturation from prototype to production including engineering design reviews.
Create documentation to support lifecycle maturation, for example process & instrumentation diagrams, FMEAs,
Correlate lab testing to field conditions to make useful comparison and predictions.
Required Skills and Experience:
Degree in systems engineering, mechanical engineering, electro-mechanical engineering, systems engineering or a related field
5+ years experience in relevant industry
Experience in both an industrial and product development setting.
Good knowledge of structural design, thermodynamics, heat transfer, fluid flow design and selection of mechanical components.
Knowledge or experience with fuel cell technology
Ability to create Process & Instrumentation Diagrams
Must have a broad understanding of hydraulic, chemical and electrical processes.
Demonstrated ability to develop creative solutions to meet cost and functional requirements.
Strong attention to detail with excellent written / verbal communication skills.
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.

From bonuses to benefits, our people work hard, and we believe they should be rewarded for it. We care about career growth and development. Assigned to the Strategic Data Integration and Intelligence Analytical Unit (SDIIAU) in the Criminal Operations and Intelligence Division, you will be responsible for analyzing information from a variety of sources and making recommendations to address gun and gang violence. This position is funded through the provincial Gun and Gang Violence Action Fund. Primary duties include:

Collect, summarize and interpret data and information to produce intelligence and operational enforcement documents aimed at advancing operations and investigations, producing leads and identifying possible offenders.
Create queries and visualizations (using Structured Query Language: SQL, Power Query, Power BI, ArcGIS PRO (or equivalent) on data to advance investigations and offender management programs.
Perform tactical analysis utilizing a variety of analytical tools such as ArcPRO, Power BI, Geotime, Excel and i2.
Prepare comprehensive analytical packages focused on issues pertaining to gun and gang violence.
Produce and present written and oral recommendations and provide presentations on identified priorities.
Conduct communications (including open-source intelligence - OSINT), social network (SNA) and production order analysis to determine viable considerations for investigation, enforcement and further information collection and development.
Present analytical findings in court and facilitate criminal prosecution by generating written and graphic material to enhance the understanding of the investigative process.
Initiate and maintain relationships with internal units, as well as appropriate external agencies, to gather and disseminate information and analysis.
Liaise with partners and external agencies to identify crime trends and movement from the municipal, regional, national, and international level.
Working Conditions: This position involves exposure to graphic, disturbing, and offensive subject materials, and may require work outside normal business hours.


Qualifications
A Degree in Data Science, Social Science, Spatial Analysis or a related field with a minimum of 3 years of demonstrated research and analytical experience within a public safety context; OR a Master's degree and a minimum of 1 year of analytical experience is required.
Demonstrated ability to conduct research, formulate/ test hypotheses and provide recommendations is required.
Advanced level skills in Microsoft Office Excel, Power BI and intermediate to advanced ArcGIS PRO (or equivalent) are also required.
Proficiency with Palantir, GeoTime, i2, SQL, Power Query, DAX is considered an asset.
Preference will be given to applicants with experience in a law enforcement or public safety context.
Previous experience in writing/presenting recommendations/intelligence analysis is preferred.
Success in this role requires: analytical thinking skills, change management, coaching and development, communication, efficiency and thoroughness, focus on results and relationship building.
Pre-employment Requirements
An enhanced security clearance and pre-employment polygraph will be conducted.
Applicants selected for an interview will be asked to provide a sample of their work.
Applicants may be tested for appropriate skills.
Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications. Education obtained from out of country must have or be able to obtain, an Education Credential Assessment (ECA) for confirmation of equivalent credentials.
