Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As the Lead Machine Learning Engineer, you will lead enablement of the MLOps platform and adoption of enterprise cloud technologies to expedite automation, productionization, and delivery of AI solutions at scale for the RBC Insurance business. You will work with enterprise software engineers and data engineers to incorporate ML/AI technology into new and existing pipelines. You will also assist the data science team at RBC Insurance with building AI/ML-based solutions for the business problems through close collaboration with business stakeholders.

What will you do?

Be innovative, a problem solver, and a fast learner capable of thinking outside the box to research, prototype and deploy ML/AI solutions to business problems with focus on scalable services and tangible outcomes.
Be passionate for making developers and data scientists more efficient through DevOps, CI/CD, Automation, optimization, and adoption of MLOps principles and lead the implementation of DevOps and MLOps practices and tools.
Assist the data science and software development teams with development, experimentation, productionization, and integration of the AI/ML solutions and data pipelines.
Collaborate with enterprise technology teams to develop and reuse ML/AI solutions and adopt enterprise cloud technologies to drive GenAI uses cases.
Produce data-driven insights and visualizations to help with informed decisions and actions by telling a convincing story and effectively communicate findings to business partners and executives.
Provide mentorship and guidance to other ML engineers and data scientists in the team.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

Minimum 3 years of industry experience building integrated and automated AI solutions and pipelines in production.
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or relevant fields.
Experience with leveraging MLOps, cloud computing, and data science platforms like Microsoft Azure, AWS, and Snowflake for implementation of AI, GenAI, and RAG solutions in production.
Experience writing code in more than one programming language commonly used for backend development and experience developing and consuming Webs Services/Rest APIs in a secure fashion.
DevOps experience with continuous integration/delivery best-practices, technologies, and tools such as GitHub, Jenkins, Nexus, JIRA, Confluence, as well as containerization tools and technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, RedHat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP)
Effective communication skills to work with cross-functional teams, explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and providing technical leadership and mentorship within a team.

Nice-to-have

Experience in developing semantic search engines, AI chatbots and agents and working with conversational AI platforms
Experience with big data technologies - parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark, NoSQL/SQL databases
Experience developing robust data pipelines that can automate data flow from various sources into the system.
Experience managing data scientists and engineers.
Product ownership and stakeholder management.
Experience working in an Agile development environment.

What’s in it for you?

A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans
Competitive pay and high-earning potential
All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career.
Flexible work/life balance options
Sophisticated RBCI and enterprise software tools and technologies to boost your productivity.

RBC Insurance is an organization that succeeds by bringing out the best in its people. RBC respects and responds to the many competing and evolving priorities in our lives – so you can focus on what you can do best – putting clients first.

Amazon ‘s Tax engine organisation is looking for a passionate and innovative science leader to take its science initiatives to new heights.
Amazon Tax Engine platform backs all of the orders placed across Amazon e-commerce. We serve Amazon customers and sellers by correctly computing and collecting the tax amounts when an Amazon order is placed globally. We are responsible for correctly attributing products to the correct Tax categories applicable for the specific country, state and county, providing core calculation services that calculate taxes (sales tax and VAT) for all Amazon sales, physical and digital. Our challenges include staying on top of the complex and ever-changing global tax legislations as well as computing calculations correctly and quickly, thousands of times a second, with accuracy close to 100%.

We use language models at scale for Tax classification of the diverse products in Amazon catalogue We have a growing portfolio of science problems that includes balance of predictive and generative AI -including language comprehension, causal reasoning and active learning.

Key job responsibilities

Manage and mentor a talented team of senior Appleid Scientists and SDEs.
Improve process and methodologies pertaining to deliverables of the team.
Strike the right balance between experimentation and delivery for sustained impact and long term gains.
Partner with stakeholders and customers to build roadmap for new products and services.
Experience building complex software systems, especially involving deep learning, machine learning and computer vision, that have been successfully delivered to customers
Experience communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs

Position Summary

The Manager will collaborate with cross functional leads from all aspects of the business to help ensure delivery of initiatives; overall, this position is responsible for leading the implementation of advanced analytics across regions to support our journey to cost competitiveness and to enhance overall performance.

Purpose Of Role
The primary purpose of this role is to harness the power of data to provide actionable insights, improve operational efficiency, and support strategic initiatives across the supply chain. The SCA Business Analytics Manager is essential for leveraging data to drive business strategy, enhance decision-making, and help foster a data-driven culture within the organization. This requires a blend of critical thinking, technical expertise, and leadership skills to effectively manage analytics projects that support McCain's journey from Good to Exceptional.

Responsibilities And Accountabilities

Think big and plan ahead, analytical insights and reporting: derive insights for cost savings through analysis of data sources to evaluate performance and identify trends
Bring out the best in our people, collaboration with regions: work with regions to drive target setting and initial gap closure

Department Faculty of Science - Physics
Posted date November 8, 2024
Closing date December 15, 2024
Position Type Full Time
Description

Working for the Department/Faculty

The Department of Physics has approximately 48 faculty with research interests in condensed matter physics, astrophysics, biophysics, geophysics and subatomic physics. Our condensed matter theory group currently focuses on superconductivity, topological quantum materials, computational physics, and quantum simulation. Our experimental condensed matter group is well equipped with labs for ultrafast laser spectroscopy, scanning tunneling microscopy, transmission electron microscopy, low-temperature physics, cavity optomechanics, and ultra cold atoms; as well as $100M+ in equipment at the university’s characterization and fabrication facility (nanoFAB). The National Institute for Nanotechnology (NINT), located next door to the physics building, also houses a number of condensed matter labs. Access to high-performance computing resources is available through the Digital Research Alliance of Canada. Initiatives by the Governments of Alberta and Canada provide exceptional opportunities for additional funding to establish new research programs at the University of Alberta.

Position

The Department of Physics, University of Alberta (http://www.physics.ualberta.ca/) invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position in theoretical quantum physics and machine learning. We are primarily seeking an emerging scholar to hire at the Assistant Professor level who is committed to excellence in teaching and research. Applicants must possess a PhD in physics (or related field) and have the potential to develop an innovative and externally-funded research program in theoretical quantum physics and machine learning. The successful candidate will be expected to build a strong, independent research program, supervise graduate students and teach physics at the undergraduate and graduate levels.

To be successful, candidates must also receive the endorsement of the Alberta Machine Intelligence Institute (Amii) as suitable for nomination to a Canada CIFAR Artificial Intelligence (CCAI) Chair at the University of Alberta.

Amii is one of three institutes named in the Pan-Canadian AI Strategy (https://ised-isde.canada.ca/site/strategie-ia/) and represents more than 35 artificial intelligence (AI) & machine learning (ML) researchers at the University of Alberta, as well as CCAI Chairs at post-secondary institutions across Western Canada. The CCAI Chair includes research funding for at least five (5) years. This position is part of a University of Alberta cluster hire in the areas of research strength that include Health, Energy, and Indigenous Initiatives in health and humanities, among others (https://www.ualberta.ca/en/research/index.html). The University of Alberta is world-renowned for its strength in AI; this cohort will bring together and foster the next generation of scientists leading the development of machine learning for societal benefit, fulfilling Amii's mandate of AI for good and all.

The successful candidate will also be nominated for associate faculty member status with Quantum Horizons Alberta (QHA). Initiated by a $12-million gift from a group of visionary donors, QHA is a new $25-million Alberta-wide initiative to pursue transformational research in fundamental and theoretical quantum science (https://www.quantumhorizonsab.ca/). QHA provides funding for eight new faculty at its three host universities (U. Alberta, U. Calgary, U. Lethbridge), focused on foundational quantum science research, including four at the University of Alberta. QHA also provides research support to its faculty members with funding for graduate students and postdoctoral fellows; research infrastructure, travel and collaboration across all three QHA nodes; and participation in QHA seminars, summer schools, and conferences.

The anticipated start date for this position is 1st July 2025.

Salary will be based on the incumbent’s qualifications, experience, and achievements and in accordance with the Faculty Agreement.

Qualifications

PhD in physics or related field.

Candidates must also demonstrate how they will work to expand the diversity of the Department through a statement about equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI). In the EDI statement, candidates should describe how they plan to incorporate these considerations into their teaching, research, and service. Candidates are also encouraged to describe how they will contribute to increasing the diversification of ideas within the Department of Physics.

As Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer in the Selling Partner Financial Tech organization, you will own our data strategy for the end-to-end Selling Partner financial experience. You will work with a co-located team of Product Managers, Software Engineers, Financial and Accounting Analysts to drive towards our goals of improving the Selling Partner financial experience, reducing controllership risk and improving debt prevention and recovery. This will require you to: 1) define what metrics we should instrument for new products, and work closely with the engineering team on data instrumentation and building data pipelines, 2) own analytical deep dives to drive insights that shape our product investments, 3) continually improve our existing analytical products, 4) ensure the health of our financial cluster, and 5) own the metrics and reporting for monthly and quarterly business reviews. You will also have the opportunity to partner with a science team to shape how we leverage ML and AI throughout the financial experience, such as leveraging anomaly detection to prevent errors from being published in our financials.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment with limited supervision. You must be a fast learner who can quickly absorb the nuances of Amazon's varied financial programs and processes. You need to be analytical in your decision making, with a demonstrated ability to drive issues to completion.
Key leadership principles for being successful in this role are:

Customer Obsession: You will work with Selling Partners, internal business teams, accountants, and financial analysts to deeply understand their needs and the analytical problems we are solving.
Dive Deep: You will deep dive financial metrics to produce insights that drive product decisions.
Think Big: You and the Product Management team will set a bold direction for how the Selling Partner financial experience should function in the future.
Deliver Results: You will build financial reporting and analytics capabilities from the ground up, delivering on your bold vision.
Key job responsibilities

Your responsibilities will include:

Interfacing with Product Managers, internal customers (such as business teams, accounting and finance analysts), gathering requirements and delivering business analysis.
Producing written recommendations and insights for key stakeholders that will help shape effective strategies.
Owning the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Solving complex business problems with analytically derived solutions, applying appropriate analytical best practices.
A day in the life

You will meet with Accountants, Finance Analysts, and Product Managers to deeply understand the needs of our Customers.
You will build net new reports and analytical tools for these Customers that will be used to support creating accurate, timely and complete financial statements for Amazon.
You will brainstorm new ways for us to measure the success of our business, and then implement these metrics.
You will be curious about our data, and drive insights that shape our product roadmap.
You will advise Product Managers and Engineers on how to instrument our metrics.
You will have the opportunity to shape how we use machine learning to drive results for our Customers.
You will continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers.
You will develop programs, methodologies, and reports for analyzing and presenting data.
You will effectively collaborate in a fast-paced environment with multiple teams in a large organization.
Experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs
Experience managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership

You will leverage cutting-edge data management and analytics techniques to drive the success of the Collections function by defining, implementing, and tracking best-in-class collections strategies. Your role will focus on improving processes and driving business value through data-driven insights and technological advancements. You will work at the intersection of data management, process improvement, communication, and domain knowledge in Retail Risk Management, ensuring consistent process execution and oversight. Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:




Direct the development and implementation of data-driven strategies for collections, integrating cutting-edge technological improvements.
Utilize data-driven insights to provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders, aimed at minimizing loan losses, optimizing collections, and enhancing operational efficiency.
Identify, quantify, and report all credit risks associated with collections, ensuring comprehensive risk management across all components (People, Data, Process, Technology, and Strategy). Demonstrate a strong understanding of portfolio performance metrics and originations metrics.
Oversee the acquisition, processing, and analysis of both structured and unstructured data to support robust reporting and analytics. Ensure data integrity and accuracy through effective data governance practices.
Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to support data analytics and reporting needs. Implement data warehousing solutions to consolidate and manage large datasets efficiently.
Develop and implement automated solutions for repetitive tasks and processes to improve efficiency and accuracy. Utilize scripting and automation tools to streamline data processing and reporting workflows.
Create and automate detailed performance reports and dashboards to provide real-time insights to stakeholders. Develop early warning systems to monitor and guide collection efforts effectively.
Lead projects focused on leveraging data analytics to improve collection efforts and recovery rates. Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to develop and deploy advanced analytical models.
Recommend and implement process enhancements using a test/control framework to drive data-informed decisions that boost profitability. Continuously seek opportunities to optimize and automate processes.
Develop and implement policies to support customers in need of loan modifications, based on rigorous data analysis.
Monitor and guide collection efforts through detailed performance reports and early warning systems. Ensure that all reporting is accurate, timely, and actionable.

Master’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong background in quantitative analysis and data management.
Expertise in database management and data analytics tools such as SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Proficiency in data engineering, including designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Experience with large and complex databases.
Advanced skills in automation tools and scripting languages (e.g., Python, R) to automate repetitive tasks and reporting workflows.

Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative property and casualty insurers. We can’t do that without our people, so we embrace and encourage a culture that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.



We offer a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Bring your true self and be a part of our journey. It’s better here.



In your role as a key member of the finance transformation team, reporting to the Senior Manager of Finance Transformation, your responsibilities will extend across a range of functions, emphasizing both finance and data science expertise.

Your work will involve extensive collaboration with various teams such as Finance, Enterprise Project Management Office (EPMO), Technology Solutions (TS), Enterprise Change Enablement (ECE), Human Resources (HR), Enterprise Data Governance (EDO), vendor partners, and other business units. This collaboration is critical for streamlining processes and fostering a unified approach to finance modernization and data-driven decision-making.

In the realm of data science, you will leverage your expertise in data modeling, analysis and visualization to support and enhance business processes, working closely with finance teams and stakeholders to improve financial reporting and operational efficiency. You'll be responsible for managing financial data analytical workspace, including data extractions, development of data models and pipelines, reconciliations, and thorough analyses. These activities are crucial for maintaining data quality and integrity within Oracle, essential for the financial close process and reporting.

As a product advocate and Oracle Super User, specializing in Oracle Cloud data platform, your role will be to provide support and guidance in data modelling, analysis, transformation and reporting within the prescribed guidance of the Enterprise Data Office. This includes a deep engagement with Oracle Cloud Data Platform, Oracle Analytics Cloud, Google Cloud Analytics Workspace and data modelling tools.

You will apply advanced data science methodologies to analyze complex datasets, focusing on the interpretation of financial data to inform tactical and strategic decisions. This will include developing a deep understanding of data lineage, verifying data segmentation and patterns, and using Python, SQL, and Oracle to ensure data quality and integrity. Your work will support audit checks and contribute to the integrity of financial reporting.

Fulfilling compliance requirements as part of the month-end cycle will also be a critical part of your role, automating processes to meet monthly reporting deadlines.

In addition to these responsibilities, you will be instrumental in supporting and training end users. Developing and updating process documentation and standard operating procedures will be key in enhancing the organization's understanding and use of financial systems and data analytics tools.

Through your combined finance and data science expertise, you will drive financial and operational excellence, ensuring that the finance team not only meets but excels in its modernization and continuous improvement objectives.

As a Data Scientist, Finance Transformation, you will be at the forefront of integrating finance, data science, and product analytics. Your role involves:

Leveraging deep understanding of complex financial datasets and systems to extract actionable insights and manage intricate financial data architectures, using advanced data analysis to support key financial decision-making in Google Cloud Analytical Space combined data modelling tools
Translating business needs into data-driven solutions within financial products, conducting comprehensive product analysis to drive product strategy and development, and aligning product features with financial goals.
Enhancing data models for financial data management to ensure quality and integrity, supporting financial close reconciliation, reporting, and analysis.
Identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance financial operations efficiency, coordinating master data management, and overseeing the month-end cycle for accurate reporting.
Supporting complex projects at the intersection of finance, data systems, and business needs, leading initiatives for financial system enhancements and operational improvements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
Acting as a liaison between finance, technology, and business units, effectively communicating complex data insights to stakeholders and executives, and facilitating training and support for end-users in financial data systems and analytics tools.
Driving continuous improvement initiatives in finance data management and analysis, staying updated with industry trends and technological advancements, and supporting the development of a finance modernization roadmap.
Assisting in change leadership during finance modernization and continuous improvement journeys, ensuring smooth adaptation to new processes and systems.
Tracking and reporting on performance metrics and objectives to ensure results-oriented delivery in line with financial and regulatory requirements.

In this role, you will not only continue to excel in core areas of finance master data management but also extend your expertise into data science, analytics and reporting. This will position you as a crucial driver for technological and strategic advancements within the finance sector, enabling the organization to navigate and excel in an increasingly data-driven landscape.

You will provide support for change leadership and assistance during the transition phase navigating from current state to various phases within the finance modernization and continuous improvement journey driving business centric initiatives to meet overall organizational goals and objectives.

You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement will require skills to support remote work and the ability to attend some meetings or sessions at the office.

How You’ll Succeed

Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Proficiency in dissecting complex data sets and systems to provide insightful solutions. A creative approach to problem-solving that allows for innovative solutions in data analytics and financial management.
Team-Oriented Approach: Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams across the organization. Foster a team environment that encourages shared goals, mutual support, and cooperative problem-solving.
Advanced Technical Proficiency: Skilled in finance data management tools such as Python, SQL, and Oracle, with a commitment to staying abreast of new technologies and continuously enhancing technical skills.
Effective Communication Skills: Exceptional ability to articulate complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. This includes creating compelling presentations and reports.
Strategic Thinking and Business Acumen: A strong understanding of the broader business context and financial strategies, aligning data analytics and product decisions with the organization’s goals.
Detail-Driven Focus: A meticulous approach to work, ensuring high standards of accuracy and quality in data management and analysis.
Adaptability and Continuous Learning: Being adaptable in a rapidly evolving finance and technology landscape and committed to continuous learning and self-improvement.
Leadership and Influence: Demonstrated ability to lead initiatives, inspire team members, and influence decision-making processes at all organizational levels.
Risk Management and Compliance Awareness: Awareness and understanding of the regulatory environment and compliance requirements relevant to financial data, ensuring strict adherence to these standards.

Who You Are

You will support financial data stewardship, big data analysis and reconciliations through adherence to data governance policies, effective system management through Oracle applications and Google Analytical Workspace. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of data and information. You will be adept at analyzing and modelling data through various platforms. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way that is insightful and prescriptive.

You embrace and champion change. You will continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver your best.

You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile because it's the right thing to do.

You understand that success is in the details while not losing sight of the big picture. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

You demonstrate experience and knowledge of Oracle Cloud ERP, Microsoft Office and associated Power Platform, JIRA, Confluence, database processing and data modelling & visualization through SQL, Python, Tableau, and Power BI. Knowledge of Collibra would be advantageous.

Working on multiple work streams excites you, and you are able to use ambiguity as an opportunity for high-level thinking

Requirements:

University Degree or college diploma in data science or information systems, or a related discipline
Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object-oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques and data modeling
Extensive experience in product analytics, projects, and working with developers and engineers on robust data pipeline
Experience working with various levels of business stakeholders, from executives to engineering and business teams.
Experience creating data product strategies, building data products, and continued iteration after launch
Experience in cloud-based ERP systems and implementation of ERP systems would be advantageous
Experience in utilizing Google Cloud products and services to configure an analytical workspace tailored for finance. This includes leveraging cloud-based tools for data storage, analysis, and visualization to enhance financial data management and reporting capabilities.
Master data cleansing and coordination experience
Data visualization experience
Business process experience with exposure to MS Visio
Strong communication to effectively communicate and lead cross functional sessions
Financial accounting and reporting exposure with data analysis would beneficial
Experience in the insurance industry is an asset, but not required

Salary range: $74,100 - $136,500

Join our team and what we'll accomplish together




TELUS is on a mission to revolutionize organization outcomes through insights, data and AI. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team, in the Chief Information Office, is at the forefront of this transformation. We're a high-octane team of innovators, building the foundations and capabilities for a data-driven future.





We are on a continuous journey for driving TELUS into a world-class leader in data driven organization, doing so by delivering analytics capabilities, unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling and a digital growth mindset culture. We are entrepreneurial, fun and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment.





Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for AI and technology? We're seeking a Senior Strategy Manager to join our team and help shape and drive TELUS' AI journey. This is a fast-paced, high-impact and visibility role for a self-starter who thrives in a dynamic environment and will work alongside brilliant minds and teams to develop and execute a data and AI strategy that drives unparalleled value for our customers.





As a senior member of the team, you will play a key part in developing and driving data and AI maturity across TELUS. Using your passion for technology, communications and creativity, you will drive the awareness of multiple transformation efforts and promote the vision and behaviors to accelerate our transformation, translating technical lingo and complex ideas into engaging, easy to understand content decision makers. You will work across the organization to drive adoption of analytics and AI solutions for tangible business outcomes and AI maturity. Along the way, there will be a ton of opportunities for both personal and professional development while developing long-lasting relationships within the TELUS family.


What you will do
Support the acceleration of data and AI strategy across the enterprise to enable the organization in meeting its strategic and financial objectives
Devise a plan across all business units to proactively drive adoption of responsible AI and analytics, fostering AI maturity with measurable improvements and change management
Conceptualize and implement robust processes to streamline AI demand with delivery teams in an efficient and effective manner
Demonstrate strong understanding of technology, data science and AI landscape with the ability to drive points of views, strategic thinking and impact
Evaluate AI capabilities from a product centric lens for re-usability and scalability by connecting the dots among initiatives across products and business units
Lead storytelling in executive leadership forums with presentations, articles and communications to provide visibility and drive decision making
Lead annual strategy exercise and business planning with senior leaders including material creation (business cases, executive presentations) and coordination across teams and units
What you bring



Maturity in identifying and driving strategic initiatives, anticipating interdependencies and impacts up and down streams
Exceptional communication, collaboration and relationship building skills
Compelling storytelling and presentations skills to executive audiences
Infectious positive and collaborative attitude while working across cross functional teams even in in stressful or pressured situations
A proven track record of independently driving complex projects from inception to completion in a fast-paced environment, delivering results under tight deadlines
Passion for technology and AI with agility in your way of thinking and working
Financial modeling and business planning
Flexibility, accountability and openness to feedback with the ability to pivot rapidly

Great-to-haves




University degree in Business, Information Technology Management or Engineering; Masters degree desirable
5-7 years of experience in a Management Consulting or strategy with a large organization
3-5 years of experience working in Technology with senior leadership
Experience in developing and implementing data and AI strategies is highly desired
Experience defining and implementing new operating models, change management and standing up transformation efforts

Salary Range: $94,000-$142,000
Performance Bonus or Sales Incentive Plan: 15%

Comprehensive total rewards package highlighting competitive salary and bonus structures, minimum 3 weeks of vacation, and flexible benefits plan to meet the needs of you and your family
Flexibility to work in-office, virtually or a combination of both, based on the role's requirements

Career growth and learning & development opportunities to develop your skills

We’re a people-focused, customer-first, purpose-driven team who works together every day to innovate and do good. You’ll find our engaging, high-performance culture personally fulfilling, professionally challenging, and financially rewarding. Sommaire du poste :



Le conseiller ou la conseillère bilingue, Données et analyses, fournit une expertise en matièred’affaires, d’analyse et de produits à toutes les équipes de vente et aux clients sur des plateformeset des produits spécialisés et collabore avec les partenaires des ventes et d’autres partenaires commerciaux pour offrir des solutions et résoudre les problèmes à la satisfaction du client.
Ses responsabilités comprennent la conception, la gestion et la livraison d’aperçus et de solutions analytiques au moyen de l’analyse, de la gestion des données et de la science des données. Letitulaire du poste fournit une expertise technique et stratégique opérationnelle et assure une bonne
gouvernance des sources de données, des modèles, des attributs et des plateformes d’analyse. Ses autres responsabilités consistent à fournir un leadership éclairé tant à l’interne qu’à l’externe en ce qui concerne l’utilisation et l’application des données et des analyses à des fins d’avantage concurrentiel.



Tâches

Travailler avec un groupe de clients attitrés pour comprendre et structurer leurs problèmes d’ordre commercial en tirant parti d’un sens aigu des affaires et d’une approche organisée de résolution de problèmes.

Soutenir le processus de vente en offrant des services-conseils sur les affaires, les analyses et les produits. Travailler avec les parties prenantes internes pour évaluer, formuler et présenter des solutions qui démontrent une expertise en matière de besoins opérationnels du client et qui appuient ses stratégies.

Apporter une connaissance approfondie du cycle de vie du consommateur et de l’application pertinente des données.

Comprendre comment jumeler efficacement les capacités d’Equifax aux interfaces de système client et aux processus opérationnels.

Communiquer avec les équipes de développement et d’exécution pour assurer la résolution des problèmes liés aux exigences et aux solutions commerciales des clients et une livraison dans les délais.

Effectuer régulièrement des validations, des échantillons de données, etc., pour s’assurer de maintenir le rendement supérieur des produits.

Maintenir une expertise reconnue en explorant activement les données d’Equifax pour obtenir des aperçus pertinents et exploitables pour nos clients des secteurs des services financiers, des gouvernements, des rehausseurs de notation, des télécommunications ou de l’automobile.

Démontrer l’expertise des données d’Equifax et le processus de conversion de ces données en renseignements commerciaux exploitables

Expérience nécessaire :

Au moins sept ans d’expérience dans l’analyse des risques et du marketing.

Bilinguisme (français/anglais).

Expérience en statistiques et en analyses– élaboration de méthodologies pour le travail d’analyse et de conversion des résultats en perspectives et stratégies opérationnelles exploitables.

Expérience dans les fonctions d’interaction avec les clients et capacité à diriger et à animer des réunions qui mettent en valeur un processus et une approche solides en matière d’élaboration de solutions.

Connaissance approfondie de l’industrie et des priorités actuelles et futures en fonction des conditions changeantes du marché.

Solides compétences en gestion de projets, sens de l’organisation et grand souci du détail et des résultats.



Ce qui vous distingue des autres

Diplôme de maîtrise, un atout.

Deep industry insight of current & future priorities due to changing market conditions

Strong project management skills, well organized, high attention to detail and results-oriented

Master’s degree preferred

We are looking for a Technical Lead, Enterprise Data & Business Intelligence who would serve as a key role responsible for overseeing the end-to-end delivery of data solutions while ensuring alignment with organizational objectives. This position acts as the primary point of accountability for Data and Business Intelligence (BI) deliverables, stakeholder engagement, and team supervision. The role combines technical leadership with operational oversight to ensure successful execution of data initiatives. It requires close collaboration with stakeholders to capture business requirements, oversee technical implementation, and ensure the continuous evolution of the data warehouse.
Working within the Digital Transformation Office, the incumbent supervises the development team, ensures quality standards are met, and maintains strategic oversight of data solutions from conception to delivery. This position plays a crucial role in bridging technical expertise with business needs, leading stakeholder engagements, establish accountabilities, and driving the advancement of data capabilities across the organization.

Stakeholder Management, Requirements Gathering & Team Leadership

Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders across business units

Act as an escalation point for technical and operational challenges

Lead code review sessions and ensure adherence to departmental standards

Foster a collaborative team environment focused on quality and innovation

Familiar with cloud data concepts – and cloud data tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS (on Azure), Azure SQL Managed Instance, Salesforce Cloud, MuleSoft, etc.
Develop and maintain data pipelines and integration patterns between on-premises and cloud environments
Architect solutions utilizing modern data blocks and SAAS platforms
Oversee API integration strategies and implementation
Guide the team in cloud-native data warehouse design and development
Ensure security and governance standards are maintained during cloud migration

Technical Architecture & Development

Develop the required solution / solution components
Implement highly extensible, scalable and high-performing SQL solutions within SQL Server, Power BI, SSIS and MicroStrategy
Architect and design BI solutions, data marts and data warehouse
Oversee the architectural design and implementation of BI solutions
Review and approve technical specifications and solution designs
Ensure all deliverables meet quality standards and business requirements
Lead the development of complex SQL queries and data structures when needed
Lead the development of various BI and Data Artifacts as required and necessary
Guide the team in implementing best practices for data warehouse design and development
Maintain oversight of data quality and integrity across all BI solutions
Drive continuous improvement initiatives for existing BI infrastructure
Evaluate and recommend new technologies and approaches to enhance BI capabilities

About SE Health

At SE, we love what we do. Every day, we bring hope and happiness to clients, homes, and communities across Canada. Job Description:
Are you passionate about being #1 on Google? Does increasing organic traffic and conversion get you excited? Do you love three-letter acronyms like SEO, ASO, CRO, GA4, GTM, and GSC? Then your search might be over. We are looking for a Website Analyst!!!!

At Go Auto, we're not just about selling cars; we're passionate about staying ahead of the curve and making a real impact in the automotive industry. We're building a team of driven minds who are ready to unleash their creativity, work hard, and drive results.

As a Website Analyst, you'll have the exciting opportunity to:
Execute digital advertising strategies that align with our business goals and objectives.
Improve and scale digital ad campaigns to maximize their impact.
Analyze and report on campaign performance, providing valuable insights for continuous improvement.
What you bring:
You have expertise in Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Business Profiles, and Google Tag Manager.
You are deeply familiar with SEO and CRO tools and concepts. A/B tests don’t scare you, and you are ready and excited for SGE.
You have strong analytical skills.
Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and BI tools for data analysis. You will be supported by a team of data scientists.
General understanding of digital marketing principles, web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, CMS), and UX/UI principles. Don’t worry, we have a full-stack dev team who does the heavy lifting.
Experience with a CDP (Segment) is a bonus.
Strong written and verbal skills in English.
You can make high-level concepts digestible for the execs.
You like to work on a team cross-functionally but also don’t mind being a lone wolf and digging into the data


But wait, there's more! Here's what's in it for you:

A Supportive Culture – We value your expertise and recognize the value you bring. Join our team and enjoy a collaborative and inclusive work environment where your ideas are heard and appreciated.
Competitive Compensation – We appreciate the dedication it took to get to where you are and we offer a competitive salary that reflects your hard work and accomplishments.
Professional Development – We're committed to your growth and development as a professional. As a Data Scientist at Go Auto, you'll have access to ongoing training and opportunities to expand your skill set.
Work-Life Balance – We understand that achieving balance is crucial for success. With generous vacation time, you'll have the opportunity to recharge and enjoy your personal life.
Comprehensive Benefits – Your well-being is important to us. We offer comprehensive benefits, including health care, dental coverage, and a health spending account to support your overall well-being.
Making an Impact – We believe in making a positive difference in our community. Each year, we contribute to causes such as the Kids with Cancer Society and Go Auto Fuels the Schools. Join us and be part of our giving back initiatives.
Career Growth – We're invested in your long-term success. At Go Auto, you'll have ample opportunities for career growth and advancement, allowing you to reach new heights in your professional journey.At Go Auto, we foster a collaborative and energetic work environment where your talent is valued, and your hard work pays off. Join us as we shape the future of digital advertising in the automotive industry! Apply now and let your creativity shine as part of our dynamic team.

Job Description:

Leverage Technology and data integration to enrich, cleanse, transform and deliver data from disparate sources into meaningful, trusted information and make it available when, where and how it is needed.

Provide consumable information to Local IT Operational teams, its respective Local IT Leadership and Business Partners related to each specific segment and their demands.

Establish data governance within Local IT as a global organization with physical presence over 80 countries, 428 Mars Units and multiple business models.

What are we looking for?

Eduction & Professional Qualification

Undergraduate degree (IT or Computer Science a plus) or equivalent functional expertise
Data Science, Data Engineering, Big Data and/or Analytics certificate is a plus.
ITLI certification is preferred, but not essential.
Fluent English

Knowledge/Experience

3-5+ years of experience in IT Service management, IT project management or similar.
Experience with Data Analytics.
Experience in dealing with business stakeholders, higher management and non-managers.
Knowledge in different data analytics tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge in ServiceNow reporting and Sharepoint Lists preferred, but not essential.
Knowledge of MS Azure is a plus.

What will be your key responsibilities?
Provide visibility of current and future Local IT service state to Local IT service state to Local IT stakeholders based on data tracked in different sources.
Identify and implement the appropriate solutions to enable data analytics within Local IT organization and produce insights for strategic decisions according to diverse scenarios raised.
Integrate Local IT data scoping different data scoping different Local IT functional areas such as PMO, SMO, ITSM Governance, Local IT Operations, and Financial.
Interface with internal and external Local IT stakeholders – Local IT Managers and Non-Managers, Service Operations & Infrastructure teams, Local IT Managed Services strategic providers, Business Partnership and eventually, local business stakeholders.

What can you expect from Mars?
Work with over 140,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Job Description:
Rakuten International oversees 7 businesses with over 4,000 employees globally. The brand is recognized for its leadership and innovation in e-commerce, digital content, advertising, entertainment, and communications, bringing the joy of discovery and access to more than 1 billion members across the world. Our teams deliver on the company’s mission to delight merchants and customers through innovation, optimism, and teamwork.

Rakuten Rewards is seeking a visionary Senior Manager, Analytics to spearhead our data-driven initiatives. This role is pivotal for someone who can inspire a team of top-tier data scientists and analysts, guiding significant strategies like fraud detection and payment executions, and shaping the future of Rakuten Rewards through advanced analytics and AI-driven strategies. The successful candidate will drive the development of a centralized data product that promotes a self-service culture, ensuring data integrity with external partners and translating complex analytics into actionable business strategies.
Key Responsibilities:
Leadership and Strategy: Lead a team of data scientists and analysts, developing strategies that impact millions of users on Rakuten Rewards’ platforms.
Project Management: Oversee analytics projects from inception to completion, collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform and execute business strategies.
Strategic Influence: Deliver clear and persuasive analytics insights to senior management, directing the strategic orientation of products and services.
Analytics and Problem Solving: Tackle a wide range of challenges using a variety of analytical and statistical methods to produce actionable insights, emphasizing improvement in revenue growth and cost efficiency.
Performance Metrics: Define and monitor key performance indicators, using them to guide goal setting, forecasting, and performance monitoring to pinpoint trends and opportunities.
Innovation and Process Improvement: Promote the adoption of new technologies and methodologies to optimize business processes and decision-making capabilities throughout the organization.
Advancement of Data Science: Champion best practices in data analysis, mentorship, and process enhancement, extending knowledge and tools throughout the organization.
Minimum Requirements:
8+ years of relevant experience in analytics, business intelligence, data science, or a related field.
High proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and a scripting language (Python/R).
Exposure to Graph Databases, understanding their application and benefits.
Experience managing high-performing teams.
Qualifications:
Degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
Proven leadership experience (5+ years) in an analytics or data science role, preferably within e-commerce or a similar industry.
Strong analytical skills, including expertise in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working cross-functionally and presenting complex information in an accessible manner.
Five Principles for Success
Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.

Always improve, Always Advance - Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen
Passionately Professional - Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best
Hypothesize - Practice - Validate – Shikumika - Use the Rakuten Cycle to succeed in unknown territory
Maximize Customer Satisfaction - The greatest satisfaction for our teams is seeing their customers smile
Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! - Always be conscious of time - take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team
Rakuten provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type. Rakuten considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws.

Overview:
Groupe Dynamite Inc. (GDI) is a Montréal-based, privately held house of integrated omni-channel brands, designing and distributing accessible, trend-forward fashion for women since 1975.

Our mission of "Empowering YOU to be YOU, one outfit at a time" is brought to life through the GARAGE and DYNAMITE banners and represents the consumer-centric core of GDI's long-standing success as a leading retailer in North America.

Today, GDI operates nearly 300 stores across Canada and the United States, as well as shoppable brand experiences at Garageclothing.com and Dynamiteclothing.com.

Job Summary:
As the Senior Director of Data, Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence, you will be a key player in shaping the future of our company by leveraging advanced data science techniques and artificial intelligence to gain insights, optimize operations, and enhance the overall customer experience. This role sits at the intersection of technology and fashion, providing a unique opportunity to influence both sectors.

Main Responsibilities:
1. Strategic Leadership:

Develop and execute a comprehensive data and analytics strategy aligned with the overall business objectives;
Drive the integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning into business processes to gain a competitive advantage.
2. Team Leadership:

Build and lead a high-performing team of data scientists, analysts, and AI specialists;
Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning within the data and analytics team.
3. Data Science Applications:

Identify and implement data-driven solutions to optimize inventory management, supply chain, and pricing strategies;
Develop predictive models to forecast customer trends, preferences, and purchasing behaviors.
4. AI-driven Customer Experience:

Spearhead initiatives to personalize the customer journey through AI-driven recommendations, personalized marketing, and enhanced user experiences;
Utilize AI technologies to enhance customer service, including chatbots, virtual assistants, and personalized product recommendations.
5. Technology Integration:

Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of data science applications and AI solutions into existing systems and processes;
Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends in data science and artificial intelligence to ensure the company remains at the forefront of innovation.

Qualifications:


1. Education:

Advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.

2. Experience:

Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in data science, analytics, and artificial intelligence, with at least 5 years in a leadership role;
Proven track record of successfully implementing data science solutions in a retail environment.

3. Skills:

Strong leadership and strategic thinking skills;
Proficiency in machine learning, statistical analysis, and data visualization tools;
Excellent communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

4. Industry Knowledge:

Deep understanding of the retail industry, with a focus on fashion and consumer trends.

Join our team and be a driving force behind the evolution of our North American fashion retail brand. If you are passionate about leveraging data and AI to revolutionize the industry, we invite you to apply and be a part of our innovative journey.

At GDI, you will be part of a growing organization that understands the importance of investing in people and offers you:
A comprehensive compensation package that includes performance-driven bonuses;
A group retirement savings program with employer matching;
Flexible group insurance with personalized coverage that meets your needs;
An employee discount at Garage and Dynamite;
Exclusive private sample sales;
A flexible vacation policy;
And more!

GDI has been repeatedly voted one of Montréal’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People.

Our promise…
No day will be like the last—we aim to be better today than we were yesterday. We are committed to employment equity.

Candidates that are retained will be called for an interview.
#LI-NR1

Description

Position Parameters
The Faculty of Science at the University of Calgary invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant Professor focusing on Machine Learning and Industrial Optimization. The successful candidate will be appointed in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. The anticipated start date is July 1, 2025.


Description of Position
The successful candidate should have a PhD in mathematics, operations research, or a related discipline with, and display potential for leading a high-impact, transdisciplinary research program at the interface of optimization and machine learning/data science, with an eye to industrial applications and the solution of read-world problems. A record of research excellence commensurate with their stage of career development and potential for attracting and sustaining external funding are also required.



Research Expectations: The successful candidate will be expected to secure external research funding from a variety of sources, to disseminate research results through various channels, e.g., publication in scholarly journals, submission to regulatory and policy documents, and participation in public forums. We place value on diverse activities like contribution to resource development (databases, protocols, software, etc.), entrepreneurship, social action, and fostering relations with relevant partners (e.g., government, indigenous groups, industry, academic, etc.).



The candidate must have strong interests in supporting the Faculty of Science¿s Data Science research initiatives and training programs. The candidate is expected to contribute to the University of Calgary's Ahead of Tomorrow strategic plan to promote transdisciplinary scholarship and innovation and empower our students and communities to tackle society's big problems.



Teaching Expectations: The successful candidate will play an important role both in teaching and in research supervision of undergraduate and graduate students. Evidence of (potential for) excellence and growth in these areas is an asset. The candidate will be prepared to teach courses in programs offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics, with a focus on undergraduate data science.


Service Expectation: Finally, the candidate should provide evidence of collegiality within their organization as well as commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI). They will be expected to fully engage in departmental and university service at the University of Calgary and work effectively with people from diverse communities and cultures.

Description of Work Environment
Successful applicants will become a faculty member in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. They will be integrated into the broad spectrum of research activities in the Faculty of Science and across the university touching on data science, machine learning, optimization, and operations research.


The Faculty of Science and Departments in the Faculty of Science are committed to supporting interdisciplinary research and teaching and we offer and support opportunities to improve your research and your teaching practice by working with people in other disciplines. The Taylor Institute for Teaching and Learning also offers professional development and additional resources for those who are developing new ways to teach.


The University of Calgary adheres to the principles of the San Francisco Declaration on Research Assessment (DORA) and strives to evaluate research impact responsibly and inclusively by explicitly considering discipline-appropriate methods for demonstrating the quality, significance, and societal impact of a broad range of research contributions.



The Faculty of Science and Departments in the Faculty of Science are continuously improving our environment and culture to foster an inclusive environment where all department members can participate and collaborate to their full potential.


The University of Calgary's comprehensive benefits and pension program is designed to promote a productive level of health and well-being to staff members through coverage for health, dental, life insurance, income protection for disability, and retirement income planning. To learn about our comprehensive benefits package, please visit http://www.ucalgary.ca/hr/academic_benefits_pension


How to Apply
Interested individuals are encouraged to apply online via the 'Apply Now' link. Please be aware that the application process allows for only four attachments (which may require you to merge documents). A complete application should include:

Cover letter (1-2 pages)
Current curriculum vitae
Research Plan (1-3 pages)
Statement of teaching philosophy/teaching dossier (1-2 pages)
Statement on equity, diversity, inclusion and accessibility (EDIA) identifying the applicant's contributions or potential contributions to advancing a culture of EDIA (up to 1 page)
Names and contact information of three references


Questions may be addressed to:
Tony Ware (mathhead@ucalgary.ca), Department Head, Mathematics and Statistics


Application Deadline: December 31, 2024

The University of Calgary has launched an institution-wide Indigenous Strategy committing to creating a rich, vibrant, and culturally competent campus that welcomes and supports Indigenous Peoples, encourages Indigenous community partnerships, is inclusive of Indigenous perspectives in all that we do.

As an equitable and inclusive employer, the University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. In particular, we encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible/racialized minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply. To ensure a fair and equitable assessment, we offer accommodation at any stage during the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities. Questions regarding [diversity] EDI at UCalgary can be sent to the Office of Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (equity@ucalgary.ca) and requests for accommodations can be sent to Human Resources (hrhire@ucalgary.ca).

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. In this connection, at the time of your application, please answer the following question: Are you a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada? (Yes/No)

For a listing of all academic opportunities at the University of Calgary, view our Academic Careers website. For more information about the Faculty of Science, click here.

About the University of Calgary

UCalgary is Canada's entrepreneurial university, located in Canada's most enterprising city. It is a top research university and one of the highest-ranked universities of its age. Founded in 1966, its 36,000 students experience an innovative learning environment, made rich by research, hands-on experiences and entrepreneurial thinking. It is Canada's leader in the creation of start-ups. Start something today at the University of Calgary. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.

About Calgary, Alberta

Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.

5+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
5+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience
5+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team
Are you passionate about Big Data and Distributed systems? Do you enjoy building new state-of-the-art products at Petabyte scale? Be part of a team of world-class engineers and industry leading experts operating one of the largest big data platforms for advertising at Amazon scale.

Key job responsibilities
We are seeking an experienced software engineer to build the next generation of systems using open source technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark and Presto and AWS services like EMR, Kinesis and DynamoDB. You will have background delivering highly distributed systems at scale, design patterns like SDKs, libraries, versioning, and a strong operational track record working with multiple teams. You will be responsible for designing and developing software products that will provide measurement and reporting to a wide set of users across all of Amazon's advertising suite across display, search, native, and video on all devices.

Candidates for this position should have strong engineering fundamentals as well as real-world experience. You will showcase diverse architectural approaches and design patterns in your technical design. Think big and stay informed about industry standards in Ad tech space. Communicate effectively across all leadership levels verbally and in writing. Lead deep technical discussions with senior engineers, collaborating to solve challenging problems. You will be able to quickly grasp new systems and provide valuable consultation.

A day in the life
We are responsible for processing all advertising events (over tens of billions of new events per day) such as impressions, clicks and views across all Amazon products. We provide petabyte-scale, low latency and highly available event look up services to a wide set of users within Amazon Ads. We apply the latest machine learning and big data technologies available on terabytes of data a day operating Petabyte size clusters. Our data must always be fast, enabling advertisers to optimize ad spend and allocate budgets effectively by providing accurate, actionable and timely performance metrics across all of Amazon’s advertising products.

About the team
Join our fast growing Amazon Ads team! This presents an unique opportunity to take ownership and lead significant initiatives to build innovative solutions to complex and challenging problems. You will encounter some of the toughest and most inspiring technical challenges of your career as you build petabyte-scale services, invent new big data paradigms, and scale for extreme growth.


5+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

We are banking at another level.
Choosing BDC as your employer means working in a healthy, inclusive, and skilled workplace that puts forward the best conditions to bring together unique teams where employees are empowered to act. It also means being at the centre of ambitious economic and financial projects to see further and to do things differently, to fuel the success of Canadian entrepreneurs.
Choosing BDC as your employer also means:
Flexible and competitive benefits, including an Employee Savings and Investment Plan where BDC matches part of your voluntary contributions, a Defined Benefit Pension Plan, a $750 wellness and health care spending account, to name a few
In addition to paid vacation each year, five personal days, sick days as necessary, and our offices are closed from December 25 to January 1
A hybrid work model that truly balances work and personal life
Opportunities for learning, training and development, and much more...
POSITION OVERVIEW
We are looking for an App and Web Analytics Implementation Expert to join our Client Analytics team within the Marketing and Communications (MarCom) department. Our team is responsible for analytics implementation across BDC digital platforms. In this role the candidate will work with our digital platforms’ products owners and developers to implement tracking solutions. They will write technical specifications, conduct quality assurance, monitor analytics to ensure accuracy and effectiveness of implemented solutions and will configure the Tag Management System.
The ideal candidate will have a deep expertise in Google Analytics, tag management systems and App & Web tracking. They will have an analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. They should be comfortable working in an evolving environment where curiosity and flexibility are key to adapt to new tools and processes.
CHALLENGES TO BE MET
Advanced Google Analytics Expertise:
Implement and maintain Google Analytics configurations.
Develop and execute advanced analytics strategies to measure website and app performance, user behavior, and marketing campaign effectiveness.
Conduct in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Create custom reports and dashboards to visualize data and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
Tag Management System Configuration:
Design and implement TMS setups, including Server-Side Tagging for improved data quality and privacy compliance.
Create and manage data layers, triggers, and tags to efficiently track website and app interactions.
Collaborate with development teams to ensure accurate data collection and integration.
App & Web Tracking Implementation and Monitoring:
Work with digital platforms products owners, developers and architects to design and implement tracking strategies for web and mobile applications.
Integrate with other analytics tools and platforms (e.g. Evergage, Firebase) to provide a comprehensive view of user data.
Creation of measurement plans and update web or mobile Solution Design Refence (SDR).
Provide technical specifications to web and mobile developers. Conduct quality assurance and monitoring.
Take accountability and ownership in resolving Digital tracking issues or bugs.
Identify existence of bugs, root-causes, coordinate solution delivery across cross-functional development teams.
Conduct regular audits of tracking implementation and identifying recommendations to improve data structure and reporting
Reporting and Dataset Management:
Work with BI team to correctly implement Google Analytics data extractions and transformation through Big Query and Databricks
Provide data transformation instructions
Develop and maintain Power BI datasets and reports that provide stakeholders with clear visibility into key performance indicators (KPIs).
Training and Best practices:
Build Google analytics training for other data analysts and end-users
Maintain and improve internal processes and documentation governing all aspects of analytics tagging, implementation, QA and reporting, including continuous improvement of these processes.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. Relevant certifications in analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) are a plus
Minimum of 5 years of experience in web or mobile application development or analytics tools (Google analytics, Adobe analytics…).
Minimum of 5 years configuring tag management systems (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch…) and implementing tracking solutions on Web or Mobile applications and 3 years of experience using Firebase.
Experience in developing analytics tagging architectures, authoring technical specification documents, and working with front and backend development teams to implement analytics tracking solutions.
Web development experience including knowledge of JavaScript (or any of its flavors) HTML, and CSS for implementing tracking codes.
Strong understanding of web and mobile analytics frameworks and methodologies.
Familiarity with Tealium iQ Tag Management and how it integrates with other platforms.
Understanding of Firebase services like Firebase debugging, and Cloud Messaging.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset. Adaptability and willingness to learn new tools and technologies quickly and a fast learner.
Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Ability to work in French and English is required
Hybrid position with two days a week in the office in Montreal

Department: People & Culture (P&C)
Reports to: VP, People Operations, Total Rewards and Analytics
Location: North Vancouver (Hybrid)

Your opportunity: We are looking for a Director of People Analytics to harness the full potential of our people data, systems, and technology. In this key role, you’ll lead the vision for people analytics, manage a high-performing team, and use data-driven insights to shape strategic decisions that benefit our people and drive business value. Joining us means playing an instrumental role in transforming our use of data and technology to shape and deliver on a forward-thinking people strategy. Your work will directly support our ability to attract, develop, and retain top industry talent, strengthening our position as an industry leader.

This role is primarily based out of our North Vancouver office and is open to hybrid remote work. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

Meet your future team:
The People Operations, Total Rewards, and People Analytics team partners strategically with the business to provide compensation, benefits, systems, analytics, and operational services. We play a critical role in the success and scalability of the people function, driving alignment, evolution, and fostering a culture of belonging that empowers high-performing, strength-based teams and values-driven leadership.
If you were the Director, People Analytics now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Lead People Analytics Strategy: Develop and execute the long-term people analytics strategy, with a roadmap that supports our evolving business needs. Shape our people systems and data ecosystem, integrating advanced analytics into decision-making across the organization.
Build and Enable a High-Performing Team: Mentor and lead a team of systems and analytics professionals dedicated to producing actionable insights, fostering data literacy, integrating and optimizing systems, and delivering reporting solutions that support all levels of the organization.
Foster Data-Driven Decision Making: Advocate and drive a data-driven culture within the People & Culture (P&C) team and across the business. Design strategies and develop tools to enhance data access, quality, and insight generation.
Deliver Analytics Solutions: Build and implement dashboards, reports, and predictive models that inform leadership decisions and monitor the success of people initiatives. Provide advanced analytics capabilities that bring data to life and drive impactful people and business outcomes.
Enhance HR Systems: Oversee enhancements within our HRIS platform (Workday) and the consolidation and integration of additional people systems and technologies that improve data integrity, reporting, and insights.
Drive Technological Innovation: Identify and implement emerging, best-in-class HR technologies that improve data management, enhance reporting accuracy, streamline system integration and consolidation, and elevate the employee experience across Arc’teryx.
Partner with Key Stakeholders: Work closely with the P&C leadership team, our parent company Amer Sports, and senior business leaders to develop and apply data insights aligned with business objectives and initiatives.
Support People Strategy: Collaborate with business leaders and P&C partners to develop systems, tools, and data that support across our capabilities, including talent acquisition, talent management, and business partnerships, to directly enable and evolve our talent capabilities.
Evolve People Analytics Model: Collaborate with the VP, People Operations, Total Rewards, and People Analytics on future HR technologies and the development and evolution of the people analytics operating model.
Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Refine the 3-year people analytics strategy and roadmap.
Lead large-scale people system implementations.
Oversee the implementation of a people data lake.
Develop self-serve dashboards and reporting capabilities.
Advance analytics capabilities and people science initiatives.
Are you our next Director, People Analytics?
You have 7-10 years of data analytics experience, with at least 5 years in a leadership role, ideally within HR in retail or a similar industry
You have a post-secondary degree or diploma in a related field (e.g. Data Science, Psychology, HR, Business) or equivalent experience
You bring a strong background in HRIS, preferably with Workday
You have a high execution focus with a proven track record of delivery
You thrive in a high-growth, agile environment, with a collaborative and adaptable approach that puts the team above the individual and drives collective success.
You are an excellent communicator, with the ability to translate complex data sets to generate insights and provide actionable recommendations to all levels of stakeholders
You are open and approachable with a customer-service mentality, always striving to do what is best for Arc’teryx and our people
You embrace a continuous learning mindset, with a passion for growing your skills and supporting the development of your team.
You exercise good judgment and consistently operate as an ambassador of the company (leading by example)
You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it
$146,000 - $182,000 a year
A reasonable estimate of the pay range is CAD$146,000 - CAD$182,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training.

Please note that the range details above reflect the base pay only and does not include our competitive bonus program and benefits that we offer.
Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance.

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.
